yfoPzvF0Mnyu07h5oqfk7Q.text: Very tasty and nice atmosphere. Service was great. My first time having Pho, so can't compare to anything, but I liked it and thought it was very good.

YfLqozNryrfc06NGNi4Trw.text: Our favorite Pho place downtown and probably throughout the valley. We always go for the vegetarian pho and their garlic noodle dish is a taste orgasm. We just tried the vegan spring rolls and they are BOMB too.

a_2WSBJxd7dZallCiFgm-A.text: I came for a late lunch and ate at the bar. Quick service and the bartender was friendly. I will be back again.

pWjICI6-R4jxfRtzEY8CDw.text: When my husband and I walked through the door, I fell in love right away. I love how open the place looked it was a total surprise because I didn't expect it took look like that. We were initially sit at the bar but it seemed a bit crowded to us. But I was looking at their bar and they have a very nice selection of liquor.  When we got sat at our table I was a little disappointed the the tables were wobbly... That is one of my pet peeves when I go out to eat. Nothing is more annoying than trying to eat your meal on a wobbly table. (But I guess its just me being in the industry as well... )  Kelvin was our server and he was so sweet. We started of with the Nem Nuong Rolls which were DELICIOUS. I've had it at other places before but I liked the ones here A LOT. The Nem Noung meat was warm where most places don't really serve it that way. And the herbs and veggies that they put into the roll just complement everything so well. I love the red shiso leaf in there- it just adds a brightness to the roll. But make sure you order these, because the table behind us had ordered some and we ordered the last order... SOOOO they sell QUICK! I had also ordered the fish cake with were delicious as well.The texture was nice and the flavors weren't to over powering. And I also liked the fact that they served it with a side of lettuce and pickled veggies to eat it as a wrap.  The chef had also sent out some Eggrolls as well some specialty dish. I really wish I had asked what it was because they were both awesome. The specialty dish had some shrimp, pork and pickled veggies all served on a shrimp chip. Very nice and scrumptious. The eggrolls came out super hot, (Just like I like them) and they were served with a side of veggies as well. (I Love when they do that) And their dipping sauce was on point. Not too garlicky, not too salty, with right amount of sweetness as well. Yum!  We both Ordered the house special, and I had ordered mine with the Additional Bone Marrow and Scallion Oil because it intrigued me. When it came out, it was nice and hot. (You'll be surprised how many times we've had pho that just came out warm.) So that was super awesome. And they had put the Bone Marrow and Scallion Oil on the side. I like to taste my pho first before i add any additional seasoning and it was PERFECT. Nice balance of flavor, not too salty, not too sweet. The cuts of meat that they used in there were super delicious as well. And their CILANTRO... My husband thought I was a little crazy, But the Cilantro that they used was sooooooooooooooooooooooo good, I've never had cilantro that tasted like that before, it was so good. (I wonder where they get their cilantro from.)  All in all, I would most definitely be back, It may be a little bit pricier than your average bowl of Pho, BUT you can tell that they use the best quality ingredients and that there is love in the food Something a lot of places lack now a days. And service was great as well so that made our meal even better.

gSf9HIX10DauPiJ428FzMw.text: This place is more than just good food and great service, it's an experience. I have been here multiple times and every time I try something new I am not disappointed. The pho is amazing, the coffee is amazing, the tai tea is also incredible.  The lovely bartender Melissa, and the server Jasmine and Mercy were extremely helpful with explaining the menu both times I have come here. Great place, amazing food, and even better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SiBuOTjLA7CglpONX7BYYA.text: Guys, I have been excited about this place for awhile now. Pho is my favorite food, and having great pho near where I work was only a dream...until now.  I ordered Traditional Spring Rolls and a Pho-dipped Banh Mi, and was not disappointed by anything. The spring rolls were fresh and delicious, and the braised pork in the banh mi was insanely good, perfect crunch on the bread, as well as some spectacular fillings and a beautiful savory broth.  Is the menu overflowing like some of the Spring Mountain joints? Of course not. This is a restaurant that you can tell wants to focus on perfecting the things it does, not trying to do all the things half assed.  One more note: The absolute best service. In the world. That is not hyperbole.  Enjoy, DTLV.

zCe7KG5_JCuJvlNomMbsfA.text: Disappointed. Was expecting the same level of service and quality of food as their sister restaurant le Thai but unfortunately they're completely off the mark.  Half full restaurant of guests and out of tea kettles, overly salted food, items on the menu aren't available because they're in the process of taking them off the menu.  Servers not attentive or friendly.  Had such high expectations but I'd say skip this and go to their sister restaurant around the corner.

xtA29YyNj9aYohgOIaKtfg.text: Contemporary Vietnamese eatery near downtown.   First of all, it is not where Yelp says it is on the map. It is actually on 3rd St. and Bonneville, right on the corner. It's one of the first floor businesses on the loft complex. Grab streetside parking for free on Saturdays and Sundays. Watch out for one way streets while navigating. It's best to approach away from Las Vegas Blvd.   This feels like a chain as it is extremely polished from the styling of the decor and menu. The decor was more contemporary American than Vietnamese but the touch of a green color scheme and plants made it feel like Vietnam, otherwise it's a slightly industrial American look.   The pho tasted exceptionally fresh and flavorful as it was served in a steel bowl. I had the special combination and all the proteins were delicious and satisfying. The meatballs were especially buttery. I felt as if the surroundings made the food taste better. The pho rolls with minced meat, grilled onions, and rice paper were unique and savory. Long story short - the food was phenomenal.   The waitstaff were attentive and friendly. The view of downtown was nice too. We will definitely be coming back!

ubWOmzcDZmKxy2FPBgtdJA.text: So i was pretty upset last time I reviewed Le Pho. But I decided to give it two more chances before i fully gave up. I have not ordered to go, and since then have not had any issues either time I went for lunch.    The food is good andnthey are very good at helping me with my now one year old son. They made him scrambled eggs at my request. I feel bad because he made a bit if a mess, but (i believe her name is Jasmine) our server was super chill about it.    Definitely plan on coming back in the future.

Blwrk7vLiGT7z2XMJtKn1A.text: Meat is actually cooked well here. Compared to other pho places.   Two for one Thai tea is cool. It's green instead of the usual red and I like it. More mellow.

prtp1LlVtESB0FR5Wrh7wQ.text: I can't wait to go back.  But service was terrible.  Party of 6 for a business lunch.  Not enough chopsticks. And the two waitresses who said they would get more for us didn't. For ten minutes. With our food on the table.  I had the pork vermicelli.  The pork had five spices. And was awesome. Like gourmet bacon. But with less fat. So flavorful.  I didn't even pay attention to the rest of the dish.  The rest of the group expressed their happiness with the food and the consensus was to return.  I guess I just need to relax my service expectations.   Also, their beer list was inviting. Dinner next time for me.

nRDCSz0HSnw7yntp2A873g.text: Servers and atmosphere were nice. I would not recommend this restaurant if you are looking for fresh ingredients and an authentic taste. Spring rolls had ice berg lettuce that was frostbite and no basil or other fresh ingredients or taste. The chicken inside of it was leathery and stale. The vermicelli bowl didn't come with any egg rolls to be found :( . The only fresh veggie it had was a handful of bean sprouts. None of the  variety of fresh flavors you expect from Vietnamese food. It was accompanied by a sad little shallow dish of fish sauce. Come here if you don't know any better, but if you do.... steer clear! Disappointed waste of calories. I should have headed toward Spring Valley :/

7yVQwgVbjzaky-xrZH7nAA.text: Trendy little fusion restaurant. We came to try the Le Pho rolls but out of pork. Did not try pho, but tried spicy duck with noodle and bok choy, too salty and nooodles over cooked but still edible and with added fresh habanero (no chilis) tasty. Ginger chicken was sweet and tasty but not  remarkable. The vegetable fresh rolls were excellent, and would bet Le Pho rolls were better if they had them.....New England Patriots did beat Pittsburg Steelers in AFC championship game and 3 big TVs over bar made it fun to watch. Service here is excellent, I'll come back when they have full menu.

DLFVLmCgpQdZNB4i33iAiQ.text: Le Pho is Le Bomb!!! Bomb food, bomb customer service, and the bartender....bomb.com!! He has the sexiest voice  I will always be coming back!

I05r0T-w766KS3A-jadNFA.text: Everytime I dine here I always have the best experience with food! The selection options for pho are the best in town. I like there vegetable options and vegan! The food is extremely fresh I highly suggest the wings as an appetizer spicy sweet with a perfect crisp.

AWqfPkzO5JWP5_BOwiAxGw.text: As I paid for my parking and strolled up, my nose was greeted with fragrant herbs and Vietnamese food smells. This definitely increased my expectations. I like the open interior and feel of the place, clever to bring a cuisine that has virtually no comparable competition in the area. That said, it'll do in a pinch but you're better off making the trek to Spring Mountain for better flavors.  Ordered the Le Pho rolls to start, shared the House Special pho and Vietnamese Poached Chicken Salad. No effort was made to course dishes: my guy's soup came out before anything else, followed by our app, and my salad trailed along a little after. We were one of two tables. Our server overall was impersonal and disinterested.   Pho was decent- broth was not quite as developed as I'd like, but portion was on par with average.  Namesake rolls were the favorite dish- popped with flavor, thanks to the garlic garnish, something I'd order again. Salad section seems to be on the menu to cater the healthy crowd but arrives looking like a plate of garnishes and no effort. Chicken was dry, portion was small, flavor lacking overall.   TIP: Maybe also avoid the sandwich section of menu- a friend warned me the $10 bahn mi, even factoring the lack of competition, isn't worth even half the price.

Erh-x86jFaiAuLtRukSKzw.text: Awesome place for lunch when you work downtown. It's a easy walk from my office. The waitresses are always on top of things and the food is delicious. I've tried the ox tail pho, pork chops with rice and their bbq plate. All are amazing! The have a full bar as well and they offer Moscow mules too! The wait is never long and your food comes quickly if your strapped for time.

9Wn3DFTJu8D6Cp7bSzuRsg.text: If you find yourself in downtown Las Vegas and like Vietnamese food (or have never tried it), check out Le Pho. The restaurant is near the state courthouse and in walking distance of the Fremont Street Experience (if you don't mind walking). It's on the corner of Bonneville, in a decent area of downtown. The food is decent. It is not "blow you away" good. But it is decent, filling, and fairly-priced, for downtown. Is this going to be the best pho you ever had in your life, if you are a fan? NO. But it won't be your worst, either. The service is knowledgeable and mostly pleasant. A good lunch.

Jn2Bf_a3buYFae_geE8OOw.text: Finally came back to give this place another try I got the mule which is my favorite drink and they now have OYSTERS I love oysters they were fresh and yummy I'll definitely be coming back here more often now that I know   Tried this place for the first time today since I live downtown and saw it was new decided why not let's give it a try!!!!  I started with the egg rolls  super yummy probably some of the best I've ever had so delicious I honestly don't even know what I was dipping them in but whatever it was was AMAZING!!   I got there cocktail that contained Hennessy I wasn't very impressed so I'll try something different next time    The decor was nice and the prices were fair   I totally be coming back to explore the menu some more

-d61bB1pZS_Qz-etn8em4Q.text: Great little pho place in downtown. The chicken pho was very delicious. My colleagues order the ox tail pho. They very pleased with the amount of ox tail in their pho and the tenderness of it. We will return.

5qJkH9TRX6CrjY8f2Rfq2A.text: Amazing! Love this downtown gem!!! Everything on the menu is fresh and delicious!!!! Wish it was closer to where I live. Great service as well.

0QKamlwToYjOzie4SNxvMw.text: I have been here a few time and ad several different dishes and it was long overdue to review Le Pho. Located downtown just north of the Arts District, Le Pho is a place I enjoy when in the area. I was a fan of his families restaurant in China Town so I knew I had to come here. I could enjoy any one of their appetizers or just order several and call it a meal but I stick to one appetizer and either get the Pho or the vermicelli bowl. -The oxtail Pho is my go to. Several chunks of oxtail still on the bone it melts in your mouth and is worth getting a little messy eating it right from the bone. Just enough of noodles and broth this is a perfect dish for me when I am sick or just need to warm up. -Vermicelli bowl with grilled pork. Grilled pork, lettuce, bean sprouts and mint on a bed of vermicelli noodles, Topped with roasted peanuts, I like to order extra pork and add the egg rolls. This is a very fulfilling dish. I like to find a reason to go downtown just so I can come here to eat. I will be back soon, very soon!!

TYc39ikAsVyMq94CxKMZig.text: Visited here for the second time.   Arrived right before noon.   Seated at the bar because I was visiting by myself. Bartender attended me, got me a glass of water and gave me menu to look at.  He came back in about 10 min, took my order.   I asked him for wi-fi password. Because,,,lunch by myself? What else is there to do? He told me it'll be on the bill and he'll bring it to me (didn't say when).  So I'm thinking to myself,,,I kind of want it now,,,when am I going to get it? how hard is it to verbally tell me the password? Or post it somewhere for everyone?  Sure enough, he forgot about my bill, and I didn't get it until I finish my food. He apologized, for your note. I wouldn't say I'm mad, but it just doesn't make sense. If you are not about to let your guest enjoy free wi-fi, why would you even set up guest wifi???  Overall, first time and this time, their customer service just lacks. They are just "not rude", or "okay". Definitely could use more smile, and enthusiasm.  Their pho, is pretty solid. One of my favorite in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House special

mLm9wpurw2oOZwhEbpvsSg.text: My partner used to work next door so I  would stop by and grab lunch with him on occasion.  Le Pho is a cute spot in the Juhl with interesting decor. If you look closely though, certain individual elements clash with each other but as a whole it seems to work.  The menu seems pretty standard for a modern Vietnamese place. We usually just get the special pho. I like that you can have additional toppings like herby oils and whatnot.  My indicator of good pho is this: after the meal, do you and your clothes smell like pho? In this case no. There pho here is a little more nuanced, a little more refined. Not saying it's good, not saying it's bad. Just ok.  Service is good during lunchtime. We usually get this one kid who always checks with the kitchen if this or that contains wheat flour, soy sauce or hoisin (gluten allergy).

He loved it, said it was yummy but in the middle of the night woke up so sick for an hour straight. I've never seen him so sick in 10 years and he said he knew it was that oxtail. Wont eat here again!

qf8jA2BBAimIwHoIshxAMw.text: In A Nutshell:  -Le Pho has a very warm & welcoming layout. -I love the attention-to-detail from the classic Vietnamese locker-style cabinets, to the classy artwork artwork on the walls.  They really designed it well. -The restaurant has an open layout minus a small wall near the bar w/ plenty of glass to let the sunshine in. -The service was very good, stopped by here for a quick drink & spring roll appetizer.  Had to cancel one of the orders mid-way & the bartender hustled back to do it.  -The spring rolls were good, but not the authentic Vietnamese variety you would expect, more show than taste. -Also, glad they had Sculpin Grapefruit IPA on tap.  Overall, it's a very nice Vietnamese restaurant and I would come back again.

CJ0kUkRvP-ksVI7fGGeOOg.text: Good food bad service. Got here at 9:20 & was told they already made last calls & weren't serving, i asked if we could order to go & they stated they already cleaned up in the back. Don't have hours set to close for 10pm if you don't serve after 9pm

YxMYIhuGCxiuLwAGWWnshQ.text: Everyone always says they hate to leave a bad review but in this case I'm not even mad about it.  Where to start?  The busser who took a our drink order was very friendly, and that's where it stops.   Our server was rude and short with us.   We ordered two Bahn Mi and the Chow Fun with chicken. Then, once our food arrived (but before tasting it) we ordered a third Bahn Mi.    As soon as we got it my friend bit into the Bahn Mi and was literally unable to bite through the meat.  I thought she was being a drama queen (she's weird about meat) but she wasn't.  I, also, couldn't bite through the meat.  At this point we tell the server that the meat is REALLY tough / pure grizzle and we can't bite through it.  Not only did she seem uninterested, she didn't offer any solution.  My coworker literally took all of the meat off the sandwich and ate it like that.  I got through less than half of my sandwich before giving up... and I can eat.    We asked if it was too late to cancel the third Bahn Mi because we didn't want to torture our coworker, and again she was quite rude, she even said "probably" when we asked if it was too late to cancel as we didn't eat any of our own.   We tried the Chow Fun.  My coworker spit hers into her napkin which wasn't a good sign.   I tried a bite and it tasted like soy sauce and boiled chicken water.  Again we ask our server "is there perhaps a new cook or something because this doesn't taste right", but she just said "no, it should be correct".    We've eaten here before and we've had BOTH of these dishes before and they were good in the past.  But this terrible service combined with terrible food and no offer of a solution has me questioning whether I will ever go back again.

LblM6hAFazOiVWeU6xrV3g.text: This place is pretty good! Smells awesome when you walk in and super clean and spacious. Coming back next time I'm in Vegas !

kozySt75gg25kQLyAuF4mw.text: Very disappointed I got the veggie pho & it had no taste. I had to add salt! Not worth $9, looked pretty tho.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty but no taste.

L0lcL6xltLW02w-2wB4ADg.text: Le Pho is the sister of Le Thai.  Located on the corner of Bonneville at the Juhl, le Pho is an amazing little spot with fresh quality yummy Pho.  Close to our house we come here quite often.   We always order either jasmine or pomegranate rooibos hot tea.   Our app is always the vegan roll a soft hand roll filled with shiitake, radish, asparagus and other yummy veggies, including Thai basil. They come with a large dish of hoisin/peanut sauce.   My better half always orders vegan Pho. Amazing broth full of flavor and A TON of noodles. Exactly how we love it. It has red onion, scallion, fresh zucchini, and sprouts on the side. I always take all the Thai basil, lime slices and fresh jalapeno off the side topping plate. :D Hubs likes it without.   Sometimes instead of Pho I order the vermicelli bowl and ask for it vegan. They pile it high with tons of fresh veggies and if I like they add crispy tofu or sauteed tofu. Its fine without it!   Please check out the photos I have posted, their beautiful food will fill you up and keep you happy and healthy!   They have tricking operating hours, check before you decide to come!

Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. vegan fried rice (not on menu) and vegan pho....wayyy too much food for two people :D sooooo yummy

XhBjGizM673Y-vyhwoZX2Q.text: I got the chicken pho and it was delicious. The broth had wonderful flavor and there was a good ratio of meat to noodle. I was surprised that there were no fixings offered- I had to ask for Sriracha and hoisin. But I'd still go back on another lunch break!

iwKa0bMWW6CIGX2XqiXfUw.text: Love the broths and fresh ingredients, consistency is there. I prefer the veggie pho, but love the brisket once in a while. Also the rolls are amazing and the watercress beef salad is to die!!!

D-WP3h6X8fh3eJsucEC8ww.text: This restaurant is great, customer service is excellent and it's always easy to eat here on my lunch break and be back to work on time!

3qLN2TJdbKV-vBPvMw37qQ.text: This place is awesome! It's the best pho I've ever had! The broth is spicy and absolutely delicious, and the veggies are fresh. It has a cool bar, and music playing. I love it!

qMt5vCJHEuZZfdCbPS9MSw.text: Was very happy with this place, the service was excellent, and the food was awesome. Also, the cocktails were on spot!

aNqWOvkg2gkgm75zktcKPQ.text: Tried this place since I heard it's owned by the same people who owns le Thai (don't quote me on this). The place is located at downtown as well, so parking can be a hassle.  The restaurant looks nice and clean, which is not something you always get at other Vietnamese restaurants... the menu is pretty simple, and of course I had to order the house special pho to see if it's any good.   The food portion is generous and overall taste good, nothing too special tho. So, I have to say for a bowl of pho, $12 is a little overpriced since I can get the same thing (or better tasting ones) at many other places.  Good to try.

wJd-F2_9k6wU4crzwWaPdw.text: Love this spot! Great pho and great spring rolls. (Try the Le Pho Roll!). They also just started a new happy hour from 4-7pm, which includes $1 oysters. Definitely worth checking out when you're in the downtown area!

HjyDLauGGvN3YIRzweyyDg.text: i've tried several pho restaurants in Las Vegas and nothing compares to the broth of the pho here! It's so delicious and the customer service is great. I love the downtown area and this is one of my favorite go to spots!

wr5BdBqBvrSr6fAVWweFRQ.text: excellent...is all I can say, great pho,soup base excellent.  service fast and friendly...my to go place now

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This simple glass is filled with an aromatic Thai green tea, so many layers, I&#39;m drinking and exotic  flower....yummy

Be9BKIiDbX_nxxtxG_b6yw.text: First of all, if you eat here you have to try the Green Thai iced tea. It's really good and also free at the moment when you check in on yelp.  The food was great and service was quick. Our server was suuper friendly. The atmosphere is cool and trendy. Will definitely be back again soon!

9nEwi7DGs7O76z96ZfknNw.text: Had the oysters a $1 during happy hour 4-7pm salt&pepper garlic wings and the oxtail pho with ribeye everything was fantastic service was great Salvador gave excellent service.

JdGUBeAbahXUuwMJW-coUw.text: While in Las Vegas attending CES 2017 we searched for Vietnamese food and found Le pho and happy we did. The signature appetizer ( called Le pho) was excellent and I could have easily made a couple of these my main course (5 to an order) but my oxtail fried rice was also very good. Everyone else either had oxtail or combination pho and everyone was also happy with their choice. You will need to plan for desert elsewhere as they only offer a coconut and you dig the meat out yourself after enjoying the coconut milk. We passed.  All and all, I give it 5 stars for great food and being an independent, small business putting out good food.

so4iV5dgRBR83tMu2jbozQ.text: The design inside is great for date night or friends. I got the iced green Thai tea it was to die for its my absolute favorite! We got there during happy hour and got chicken wings which were crispy and had good flavoring. I was a bit disappointed with the pho because the chicken was too cooked and dry. Another con was that without siracha it had zero flavor or spice. Been to a lot of pho places and I was higher hopes for this one since pho is in the name of the restaurant. I will be coming back but I'll try something else. The server was kind and they had a friendly and fast staff.

yT0yfXiimlwmS4FDI_A8OQ.text: We ordered: the Le Pho roll, the Banh Mi dip, the flat noodles, and the egg rolls. Wow. The pho broth is the best I have had in memory. The Banh Mi was very simply one of the best sandwiches in Vegas. Between eating here and the Goodwich  (via Postmates this week) DTLV has stepped up its food game again. Bravo!! And Veronica, our server, was terrific.

lXUnJ29Sn07xIL3udke2Qg.text: Great food, great atmosphere, and great staff! The food is delicious, fresh, and tasty! The staff is very welcoming and the atmosphere is relaxing. I will definitely be making several more visits to Le Pho because it makes my belly very, very happy!!

uTwmM9OcWsiETAVvJXOsaw.text: Wish I had a good review to write about this restaurant.. Other than the fact that the server assistant was attentive and nice, our visit was subpar in regards to food and service.

RJx7v5Wr4jpLAgC4kxIX1Q.text: Take your favorite Pho restaurant and then amp everything up in regards to decor, ambiance and wait staff and that is Le Pho. The food is good, but rather pricey in regards to what you can get in your regular watering hole. A deluxe Pho bowl costs me $7.50 in my normal hangout. Here it is $12. Then again, you're in Vegas!

CPZl5uxYDdlF1dWe0pKlnQ.text: Khai Vu and team does it again by bringing another authentic with a modern twist to Vietnamese cuisine! This place is in downtown LV in the commercial space of the high rise Juhl building. Super cool vibe & feel. Nice bar selection & the food was amazing! Will be returning to bring more friends and try more dishes!

1T840UWOjFdPGJMqjP1D1w.text: Wow, what a great place. Atmosphere is very cozy and stylish, modern yet comfortable. The food was amazing, you have to try the house specials. Service was excellent and friendly. Definitely will be back!

mxa7gUVnNEmTMbX9yFX3hQ.text: We ordered 2 shrimp pho and an order of spring rolls Togo. The way they packed everything was nice but both of the pho were super salty. The actual springs rolls were good, unfortunately the peanut butter dip for the spring rolls was not the best it had a funny taste. We will not be going back. Sorry!

7n17Tl3R5XS0Md4bastZ5A.text: Tried this place today for lunch...ordered takeout.   To start they were out of chicken at 11:30am which is weird. I tried to sub beef on the salad and they said no so I had to get pork instead. The salad was for my assistant who is newly diagnosed as having celiacs. I told the girl on the phone...not sure she believed me. Sorry...not just the gf trend here. Some ppl actually can't eat wheat. Anyways, the salad made her sick. Obviously not gf.  I ordered the vegan pho & spring rolls. She asked how many spring rolls so I thought they were a la carte. They're not. I ended up with 6 orders of spring rolls (was ordering for the office.) WTF. At least they'll keep in the fridge....I guess. For future reference, they're 2 per order.  The vegan pho was underwhelming to say the least. The veggies were over cooked & mushy & flavorless. The broth was ok, but mostly just salty. The noodles were weird...not normal pho noodles. They almost looked like ramen. It gave me a tummy ache.  Overall I can't recommend the food. Also the pho in Chinatown is 100x better.

u322kzKf_x08x_8qTlGd4g.text: I have to give my experience here a 3. My mother and I are Celiac and had been assured by our friends at Le Thai and Bocho that Le Pho would have something for us. They were not wrong, although the staff had next to no clue what we were talking about when we said gluten free (we were offered vegan and peanut free things, neither of which were gf).   The decor is beautiful and the restaurant was clean and open. Not too busy.   We ordered the beef pho which we split. It was quite delicious. The broth was nicely seasoned, and the noodles and meat were very well cooked. Nice ceramic bowl, and stayed warm throughout the meal.   We also ordered the traditional Spring Roll after being assured it was normally gluten free (it is not). We were served the roll and my mom took a bit of a huge piece of wonton in the middle. Wonton is usually made from wheat flour, but after we asked the waiter (who was friendly and patient) she told us the chef said it was rice flour. Ok fine.  Except literally 30 seconds later another waiter came running out to tell us it was not gluten free, and my mom already ate some. So she is going to be sick later. The chef remade them without the wonton, and they tasted quite good (although personally I am not fond of raw mint). The peanut sauce was great.   Also had the Hennessy cocktail on their menu (the name escapes me). For the amount of drink vs ice (it's mostly ice) I would say it's a bit overpriced, but quite delicious, and beautifully presented. Beware of the stir stick with the cherry. I got a splinter in my lip trying to get it off of there (I blame my dumb luck).   So essentially I wouldn't go back unless the staff gets some allergy training. Gluten intolerance/allergies are fairly common knowledge now, and I think they should know what gluten free means.   It's too bad because the pho was really, really good...  Update: both Mom and I got quite ill after eating here. Celiacs I do not suggest this place.

oMdF6XEwTjl2Q-PA6lxjPQ.text: The food wasn't bad but I've had better Pho and appetizers. I have never waited so long for Pho as it isn't a dish that has to cook. That being said the rare rib eye didn't cook in the broth as it had cooled down so much waiting to be served. Thankfully the waitress brought out some extra hot broth we were able to add. The ice coffee wasn't bad but the iced green tea was good.

33SCp65r6d35sIrmxGKasQ.text: Asian Fusion Pho who would have thought. My 1st Pho dining out after just relocating from LA a few days ago.  Okay, I knew it wasn't your $8.95 pho like in Rowland Heights but then again that's if you can find parking after going through all the damn traffic.  No parking problem here and not in Spring Mtn Rd but hey, It's Asian Fusion Pho so we go with the flow. I had the Rib Eye Pho yes, I'm a Rib-Eye Steak person and never saw this ever.  It was the bomb!!!! The soup itself is fusion for sure but it was hella excellent.  The Rib eye cut I would believe in was prime and not choice cut.  Don't know if I'll ever have beef pho again unless it was rib-eye steak. Also it was served on metal soup bowls and that's an excellent concept as pho needs to stay on the warm to hot side to really enjoy the meal.  The metal soup bowl is one way.  This tells me they understand the whole pho experience.  Many pho places just slammed it in and whatever.   Yes, there's a whole technical approach to preparing, cooking and eating pho.  Le Pho has the formula for sure. As Arnold would say, "I'll be back". You venture out and you will find.

x-AXD9evVQiVJxxa9XXjcQ.text: Mmmmm mmmmm good! Had ordered everything on specials list. Fried rice/ the Vietnamese-phill cheese steak/ garlic noodles and short ribs on point! Thanks for the great food

cyhdUpnpVvH2PHKi3DjiPQ.text: Simply the freshest, great tasting Vietnamese food in a hip downtown location!  Le Pho is one of my favorite places to eat.  Welcoming diners is a full bar with several interesting choices of cocktails.    On a cold day their Pho is just perfect!  Creative appetizers and traditional recipes make Le Pho a stand out among the other Vietnamese restaurants in Las Vegas!

D_CVr6cDGCxNrC-OcE5-JA.text: Best broth I've tasted! Been to many Pho restaurants, and this place is by far has the best tasting broth. DO ORDER the Oxtail Pho, the amount of meat they serve is a lot, definitely worth the $. Came here on a late Sunday afternoon and luckily it was also happy hour! $1 oysters baby! The chicken wings is also sooo sooo garlicky good. We also ordered the fresh spring roll, something about it is different than I tasted from other places and it's a good thing. The servers are super pleasant, the ambiance, and decor is on point. The food was so good I failed to take pics of all the yummy goodness. But trust me, everything we ordered was delish! The portions are huge, so the price (for some it may be pricey) is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Pho in town!

uqkY6ptLT1lQ1RwhR8xVXA.text: Again, I live a few feet upstairs from this joint and really want to go and eat because it's so convenient. The food is solid, but the service is literally THE WORST! We went downstairs to grab a drink and have some food and thought maybe, just maybe! Sitting at the bar would get us better service. Completed opposite, sat there for 10 min. And was never even asked if we wanted a drink :/ we left. I won't be returning until this place get their act together..... I hate leave bad reviews but this frustrates me so much :/

Peqvmho38FBjPwE7nbU_LQ.text: Another amazing place to eat. Huge portions so make sure your hungry. I tried the ribeye soup, was excellent!!! The beef broth is so good I had to tip my bowl to mouth and drink it. I recomend Le Pho highly.

VE5C22P1183m2h_8Lu_hQg.text: I guess I care about flavor too much? If you've been to any other Pho spots here in Vegas you'll know the minute you sip Le Phos broth that it's mediocre at best. Will not be going back unless it's completely free. I love pho, but this place had some pretty bad tasting pho, had to throw it away. And I rarely throw food away.  I was disappointed because the location is great, but not worth wasting money on this place.

wGSWJL1tHNDTF_XOn6MMCw.text: This is probably the best Pho we have had in town. Gotta try the Oxtail Pho, it was delish. Also great happy hour from 4-7pm with $1 oysters.

HoERfwVRMwlt1boeCvA5Dw.text: Very good food all around.  Very good service all around.  Friendly staff, priced just right, with a solid bar menu.  I came for HH (5-7pm, everyday) and tried some marinated pork and then chose the vegan spring rolls off the main menu.  Couple that with 2 for 1 wine and I was set.  Though portion sizes of the 2 things I ordered could have been bigger, I wasn't complaining because I was genuinely full and content with my choices.  The thick pork was marinated in a very thick sauce and with the addition of some sriracha, the appetizer was great. The veggie spring rolls were authentic and came with a delicious peanut dipping sauce that could be bottled it was so good.  Then the drinks during HH, 2 for 1 for a few beers and a house red and white, were good and well poured.  With many options on the menu to try, HH everyday (even weekends), and TVs and a good bar menu to choose from to watch a game after work, I will surely be back.  The only complaint would be the small HH food menu.  All they had was chicken wings, pork, and $1 oysters. All great options and rightly discounted, but hopefully more is added to the menu in the future.

YZojwU2ebHVjLTVAOWyMFg.text: The chicken pho here is very good. The best was very juicy and tender and the broth ass tasty as well. It took about 25 minutes to get our food after ordering... A little too long especially for pho.

S5f7VgggEhwVN5R6KVo6Hw.text: Great ambiance. Had a date night here. Great food! Love the lemon tea mule and vermicelli bowl. Love love love the special salad. It wasn't on the menu and I don't remember what it was called. But it was awesome!!!

8pyIJn0giaV6OLfWD6h14w.text: Call me picky. Pho broth is supposed to have undertones of nutmeg, but this place kills whatever flavor their soup base has with mass amounts black pepper. Great ambience, not so great soup. Been back once, probably won't again.

VNWdGzYKNrHxN-Qe6d4o1g.text: I'm from California out here for the weekend and decided to come to this pho and it is By far the best pho I've had and our waitress Diamond was so sweet great service!

GTFexn2dcZHxNp6Ix7fm7A.text: Our family loves pho and the broth is particularly fragrant and meaty.  My husband thinks the broth is a bit salty but the rest of us (5 of us) think that the broth works well with the rice noodles.  We order take out from this place pretty regularly as it is one of the few Downtown Las Vegas locations where you can actually park and pick up the food.  Their staff is friendly, although the service can be slow so call half hour ahead for take out orders.  Otherwise, if you are at the restaurant, plan for a longer lunch or dinner.

4WBxaNqF6iaBnjPtBYsiGw.text: If you want to get treated like trash by "management/owner". Maybe she had a bad day.... Jasmine, who claims is a server/manager/owner of the business is just plain awful. Her customer service is the worst. She belittled me and did not want to honor my yelp offer (which is not a why I was upset. If there are rules to the offers in which these are clearly stated on the offer, I am more than happy to comply). Jasmine  said it was a dine in only offer (no where on the yelp check-in does it state this), I told her that it was for a previous dine-in that was 2 weeks ago (she asked me for my done in receipt from weeks ago. iqmFuWqKeXaWIgeoIWE5fw.text: This Place was actually Really good.  We were a little of Fremont and we just came across this restaurant. I have never had Pho Before but my friends said i would really like it.  When we first walked in we were greeted and seated.  Our waitress was very nice and prompt with our order.  I didn't know what to expect so i just ordered the Sirloin Pho.  I'm not that adventurous.  My friend ordered the same thing and his wife ordered the vegetable one.  It was acually really good!  there was a lot of flavors.  I was given jalapenos, basil, bean sprouts to add in and it was great.  The price too was awesome! The huge bowl was only 10$  I think that that is awesome! will definitily go back if i am able to locate the restaurant again.

w3xPiLTTD4-37-elYJnF1A.text: 2016 Yelp 100 Review Challenge 56/100  After dropping off donations at Las Vegas Rescue Mission we were hungry so we decided to check this place out. It's located at the bottom floor of The Juhl condominiums. If you don't know the area you'll probably miss it and have to circle back around, like we did.   Compared to other Vietnamese restaurants in the valley, this one is modern and pricier. The only one in downtown, the vibe and pricing caters to the downtown area.   I loved the interior design and spacious feel. There's a full bar and happy hour options as well, which other Viet spots don't have. I looked them up on instagram and they host private events and events for local charities which is awesome.   Looking at the menu, I had no idea what to order. I didn't want Pho, and I wanted to try something new, I asked the waitress and one of her suggestions was the Pho Dipped. I decided to try that. My friend got that as well.   Pho Dipped $12 - Bahn Mi with a side of pho broth.   For the taste, size and price it was just OK. It wasn't salty, which I liked.The flavors were mediocre, nothing bad, but nothing great to make up for pricing. This was not worth the price.  I had never seen a Green Thai Tea before, so I really wanted to try it. It was buy one get one free with yelp check in offer. Offer shows "1 Free Green Thai Iced Tea", we didn't see the fine print. Price is $5 each. Small size. Thought that was pricey as well.   I guess you pay for the ambiance here.   Our first waitress was okay, felt a little rushed. While we were eating, her shift was ending so another waitress took over. The second waitress was friendlier, more helpful and knew what she was doing, like she's been doing this for years or owned the place. I only ate a half of the bahn mi. She offered durable takeout containers. Didn't expect a container for the broth, which was nice. She also offered to split the bill for us without us asking. With tax and tip we each paid about $17. That is pricey for what we got.   I would come here again to try the happy hour and if I'm in the area, but won't order the Pho Dipped. Other than that I'd rather go some where else.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pho Dipped. Banh Mi w/ pho broth &amp; a few shrimp chips
Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iced Green Thai Tea! BOGO free with check-in offer.

kHgTUJhvgaExSzDrCj5Tmg.text: I love me a good bowl of pho, but having to go to Chinatown for it can be a nuisance. Le Pho offers an array of food that differ from your typical bar menu. I had the Pho Dipped Bahn Mi and it was absolutely delicious! The broth used for the dip is perfection. I also tried the shrimp pho and I was in heaven. The cherry on top is the delightful staff, particularly Ian and John since they were very informative, attentive and genuinely fun energy to be around. They made my experience in the restaurant very fun and I would definitely go back to enjoy great food and company! They've made a regular out of me.

Y8p3nT_cLlOYWZ0RFeymmA.text: This was amazing! The sticky wings were falling off the bone. For the main course, I had the oxtail pho, and my bf had the ginger chicken.  We also order the chicken pho which was maybe a 3.5 because the chicken needed some contrast of texture and flavor, but everything else made up for it. Id go again.

abuV9SL3TXASkAtjT23kzw.text: Excellant food and great service. The vermicilli bowl with pork and an egg roll was really nice as well as the spring rolls. Hit the happy hour for drinks and appetisers. Thumbs up!

RZYHtl3ACcvjCWQWY_LCew.text: Something I don't do again. While conveniently located for me,  and I have been here several times, service had been shakey at best. First,  I'm not a fan of Vietnamese food and do not like Pho. But this place is a bar and I've eaten other menu items. The items I've eaten were good, if a little expensive. However price is a product of the location. My best description of staff and the way that I've been treated is "pretentious". And I don't know why they behave that way. A bar should be welcoming. I make more then all of them and tip well. Perhaps I'm just not the hipster they want to frequent the place. Guess what? Hipsters don't have money! I just ordered food,  a simple sandwich to go 40 minutes ago. The staff out numbered patrons 2 to 1. The bartender took my order. $12 and change. I paid, tipped him $5 plus the change and went back to my office. 20 min later I returned and food not ready. I waited another 10 minutes and left.  Let's go see if they have my food now.  1 star. Because zero wasn't an option.

d4MSGP7683WZUbGD3xB29w.text: First off, I like the idea of having Vietnamese kitchen in a bar style restaurant. I love the ambience, food, and service. Just never seen any Vietnamese restaurants do this. Typical Vietnamese restaurants will be eat and go style....not much chill and socialize.  My most favorite food today was Nam Nuang roll. Love love the idea of having this dish in a roll. Usually it is a wrap style that sometimes it s a hassle to put everything together lol. Very smart idea.  Service was excellent. Our server was very friendly and very welcome to any questions. We ordered a chicken Pho to share, and she kindly split it for us too.   If you are looking for a great place to hang out, this is a good option especially it is not located in a busy area.

Xu0RtZzUG85s_0iHwqBfYQ.text: We just love this restaurant. It has the most inviting and relaxing atmosphere. Staff is very friendly. We always get the Pho but this time we tried garlic noodle and ginger chicken as well. Everything is very hearty and tasty. We will be back

kK-dYn4XLymzN88FhifMuw.text: So I went here because of recommendation from friends and I have to say I am truly impressed!. The atmosphere was great and the staff were awesome. I love this place had a fully stock bar, so if you wanted to come here to catch some sports games you could or go on a date. I would highly recommend getting the le pho roll. Also if you like love Bahn Mi sandwiches get the pho dipped. Definitely will be coming here again.

99yMYh2FAQid6RDccmqP4A.text: The Ox tail pho was SOO GOOD. Highly recommend that. The Vermicelli salad was alright, suck thats you have to add in the eggrolls and the shrimp. The salad would be too bland without those toppings. The Bun Mi was okay, Ive had better. Everything came out to 65$ which is expensive. Overall i rate a 4 because the pho was good.

PCW3aVb2w9eg1tUDXSFEVA.text: A downtown hit since the day they opened, I finally had the chance to visit a while back. Located on the ground floor of the Juhl condos the interior is dark and intimate, despite it's fairly large size.  This is more refined and upscale Vietnamese food than what you'll typically find on Spring Mountain Road. The oysters were one of the happy hour specials. A bit of a mess with bits of shell in them, it was a dish I should have passed on. The duck noodle bowl, however, was excellent with layer upon layer of bok choy, egg noodles, five spiced braised duck, mushrooms, green onions, and a poached egg.

l1sfV4dJ1zHYZ0bf5Z014A.text: Stopped by this Vietnamese joint based on my lovely fellow yelpers reviews and I am so glad I did. I had the ox tail pho and oh my was it so great! Lucious creamy fat and meat coming off the ox tail blended so well with all the offer fresh veggies and yumminess in that bowl mixed for just a fantastic pho. I was wondering why other Vietnamese places didn't do this everywhere. I do not get out to Vegas often but I do know I will stopping by this joint to eat more of that wonderful ox tail pho.

51rBO3IeDH3CDMbefI-9BA.text: Le Pho is my go to Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas. It is by no means very authentic, but the flavors are great and consistent with Vietnamese cuisine and the interior has a great vibe. I normally share a pho - house special with beef broth is very flavorful. The vegetarian pho with vegan broth also has a pretty good flavor broth if that's your thing, but if you're just in the mood for veggies but not a vegetarian, I'd recommend the vegetable pho with beef broth. The veggies take to the richer broth flavor well, plus protein! Definitely recommend the Le Pho and Traditional rolls, I'd go there for rolls and another app too. I also enjoyed the House banh mi, the baguette is good and crunchy and there's a good amount of filling. Only thing I wasn't super into was the Nem Nuoug (pork meatballs). The meatballs themselves were good but they are drowned out by the lettuce and vermicelli when eaten altogether.

ew7mBFCEx8rQaDIDC-Jf_g.text: Le Pho deserves 5 stars for the smell it creates alone but when you get to the taste, hands down its game over. We ordered the Le Pho Roll, Bahn Mi Pho Dip, Garlic Shrimp Noodles and a Lychee Colin's.  With each bite, this little Kitchen continued to surprise our taste buds!  Needless to say, this place left us with such an amazing lasting impression from the restaurants environment, to the awesome staff and of course with every bite.  If your reading this, trust me when I say come here and eat, Le Pho is amazing! Enjoy!

QRNvkgq1bvd9hpXGQTZxfw.text: I never really like pho until visiting this place and now I'm hooked. The house special pho has great flavor and their five spice chicken wings are a must have. The staff are friendly and the atmosphere is nice. I have taken multiple people to Le Pho and they all got hooked. Looking forward to my next visit.

6mEeqww4leo5fdc3vtCNrg.text: I'm pretty much a regular here since it's not too far from my work.  They have a great environment and the food is delicious.  My favorites are:  Le Pho Rolls, Short Ribs, Oxtail Fried Rice and the Banh Mi Dip.  Khai Vu is the culinary master behind these dishes.  If you look him up you'll find he has several successful Asian/fusion eateries in town.  Highly recommend!

The duck noddle bowl: the duck and the sauce were a little too salty. Also, for $15 a bowl, they use dried shiitake mushroom. IAFHOW84OiBXBdilHOGdug.text: This Vietnamese restaurant is on the bottom floor of The Juhl in Downtown Las Vegas. It is nicely decorated. Big flat screen TV's with games (sports) on. Their bar is pretty impressive.  However, I came here for the food. Their menu has your basic Vietnamese grub.  Vermicelli Bowl: This is one of my go-to dishes. Grilled pork, vermicelli, peanuts, and fine strips of carrots. Instead of getting the sauce on the side, it was already poured on the vermicelli so, it settled at the bottom of the bowl. 3/5  Pho Dipped: Banh mi with a side of pho broth to dip your sandwich in. It comes with a side of potato chips. 3/5  These are dishes I've seen at other Vietnamese restaurants and Buddha Belly for half the price. You're paying for the location. The food was just ok.

Venvf3e8wLrW4LiVmy6PSw.text: I live at the Juhl building ( where this restaurant is located). called downstairs last night at 930, asked what time they close, they told me 11 pm. Perfect.. I changed, called from friends to meet downstairs for dinner at 10, walked in right behind a group of 3, that group was allowed to sit and order, I was told that that they were " no longer seating anyone". Um, and the three gentleman that you just sat that were being handed the menu? the restaurant had about 5 tables with people still waiting for food, I had called to confirm you close at 11 and it was still 10 pm, and you look right at my face and dont allow me to sit down for dinner. Ill be sure to spread the word at the Juhl and around downtown, stay away!

pSgbgpauytLrWcRPmLy_lg.text: Food: 6/10 Service:4/10 Price:5/10  I had really wanted to like Le Pho more, having been to both Le Thai and District One, but left severely wanting. My friend and I showed up on Wednesday night at 8pm, was greeted and sat very quickly. Our server comes by and takes our drink order, returns with drinksand takes our good order as well. We both order the house special Pho (he got the bone marrow scallion oil on the side) and I ordered the house special Bahn Mi as well.  After not too long of a wait our Pho comes out. The meat that is on top is close to the rare/raw side which I'd not s problem as it should cook in the broth, however the broth was more on the high warm side than steaming hot. The broth was okay to good, but nothing to write home about.  The bowl was nicely filled out with noodles and meats, but we both thought the ribeye cuts of meat was a little too chewy, but otherwise nice. After discussing or thoughts on the Pho (about quarter of the way in) the Bahn Mi I had ordered had not come out, nor had our server come to check on us. After asking to see our server and inquiring about the Bahn Mi, I was told that the kitchen forgot to fire it and they would be working on it. By the time my friend and I had finished our Pho the sandwich still hadn't come out. Was told that they were working on it, and because it was taking so long they would comp the sandwich.   It finally comes out, and we try it and I like it a lot. I assume most of the ingredients (bread, pickled veg, pate, maybe the cold cuts) used in it were made in house. I think the Bahn Mi tasted better than the Pho, my friend thinks the Pho is a better value than t he Bahn Mi. Bahn Mi is $9 and the Pho is $12. The Bahn Mi is severed with a side of taro chips, which I am usually a huge fan of, however the order of chips I received was a dark brown mess. It tasted burnt and of oil, and there was no crisp. That covers most of the food side of things. My friend really liked the bone marrow scallion oil, but he did note that it make the Pho very heavy (I had warned him too).  On the service side, I think I saw food runners and bussers more than our server. The guy was nice, maybe he was in the weeds, although it didn't seem that busy. Overall, I think Le Pho is okay, the food is solid, the service could be tightened up (or maybe it was a bad day). The price though I've had similar quality of pho and Bahn Mi in Chinatown for less, but as it is downtown, I understand that the price will be inflated to adjust.

Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House special Bahn Mi, didn&#39;t picture the taro chips they don&#39;t look pretty.

fZtbhVsCiNTp_-bpmcr7sw.text: Came to visit a friend who lives at the Juhl and he recommended Le Pho due to convenience and he likes the food.  I rarely have Vietnamese Food and didn't know what to expect (thought it would be too spicy.)  I was delicious!  I had the WOK TOSSED FILET MIGNON and my friend had the Vermicelli Bowl with Pork.  They kindly omitted the bell peppers from my dish.  The service was great - we ended up sitting at the bar and while the bartender had to check on the menu options, he was very friendly and didn't seem to mind my questions.  This is a great location if you're downtown and especially if you live at the Juhl!  Good prices and a nice mellow EDM soundtrack.  I was on my own on Saturday and after a busy day, I ended up back here for takeout.    I'm not giving this five stars only because I don't have any experience with Vietnamese food and don't know if it's THE BEST...but it could be.....  FYI, the service both times was great.

mvl0zghR6NrPxPo4RTVWVw.text: I love to come here and I do almost once a week if not every 2 weeks. I recommend their pho and their vermicelli bowl. Although it's not really authentic Vietnamese food, they put in a modern twist to it   If you call in for pick up, make sure to check your food and make sure everything is in there because almost every time something is missing or is not the right order.   I wanted to try something different so I tried the WATERCRESS BEEF SALAD which comes with beef, watercress, radishes on a bed of cilantro. I pick up, come back to find no watercress or even the radishes. So it was beef and cilantro. Very disappointing for whoever prepared this meal. It's also a very small salad for $12.

I love this place and can't wait to come back.

Pho has been cold, they don't cut the spring rolls in half, or cheesesteak, the cheesesteak had low quality meat last time- it was tough and there wasn't much of it. I love the atmosphere and convenience to where I live. Happy hour is pretty bomb- oysters are great. I would definitely recommend this place to friends and family, esp as a dine-in experience.

be5lW1SwlgmYcudW3Keuyw.text: This recently opened restaurant has good genes with Dan Couglin of Le Thai and Khai Vu of District One being the principal owners.  You can find many restaurants serving pho in Las Vegas, but Le Pho has raised the bar based on our experience, though visitors without vehicles may find its downtown location a bit of a deterrent.       We started off with egg rolls (northern style with pork, crab meat, wood ear mushroom, carrot & cellophane noodles) that were accompanied by a small bowl of dipping sauce, lettuce, carrots and basil.  The rolls were oil free and the best we have ever eaten.  My wife ordered pho gia (chicken soup) while I settled on the pho ribeye.  These were accompanied by fresh basil, lime, slices of jalapeno and bean sprouts.  The base of each soup was delicious, both proteins were succulent tender, and the noodles bountiful.  The sourcing for all ingredients was clearly a cut above as was the decor and service

He and I both got the lotus salads which we both liked. The amount of food was expensive for its price, it was more like an appetizer instead. Anyhow, we also enjoyed the egg rolls. fbSBX57Cnto0RTglQQzppg.text: Im teetering between 3 and 4 stars for this place, but I'll up because I think the potential is there.  Le Pho is a new Vietnamese restaurant in the heart of downtown Las Vegas, located inside the JUHL condominium complex. It was created by the same people that brought the popular Thai restaurant, Le Thai, the cool fusion like restaurant in Chinatown, District One, and his brother opened my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in town, Viet Noodle Bar. So far, by the looks of it, it should be a success.  After walking in, I noticed the interior has a really cool vibe, with a full bar, and lots of rustic wooden tables laden throughout the restaurant. There is pop music playing in the background, and it just encourages fun times.  I sat down and ordered some dishes. The server was really nice and I waited. What is cool is that there is a Spring Roll bar where all the spring rolls are made. I noticed the Banh Mi on the menu are in the $9 range. Not too sure how I feel about that, but, it could be some super special one that I've never had before. I might check it out.  Knowing that my food would take a while since this was opening day, I won't  comment on how long it took for my appetizer to come out, it was a bit... But there are hiccups to every opening.  Nem Nuong spring roll - they either offer this as an appetizer in a bowl form, or as a spring roll form. I ordered the spring roll version. When it came out, I thought it was OK. The flavors were all there and I really liked the peanut dipping sauce, I thought that the pork could have been better, and the rice paper wrapping was a little tough. But I thought it tasted 'just OK'.  House Special Pho - it came with ribeye, meatballs, tendons and tripe. First, I thought the broth, the most important part of the Pho, was good. A little bit more cloudy than I would have liked, but I could taste the beef and spices. I did have some wilted bunch of basil, but I just put that to the side. The meats were good though.  I was going to give it 3 stars, but it is opening day, and there is always stuff that needs to be refined, even after a business opens. I think when it's up and running at the max, it can just be as successful as their sister restaurants.

IroHXixjiHYwSmQcxGdD1A.text: We stopped by on a Sunday evening around 7pm for dinner. It was not busy and we were seated right away. The decor and ambiance is fun and comfortable. The servers are prompt and friendly.  We ordered some Egg Rolls, a Chicken Pho and a Vermicelli Bowl. The food was very very good.   It's very likely we'll be back again some time. Good place!

cz41WpxCk0_e30YT_2XMag.text: This places not authentic and the pho is not that good. Very small uncomfortable dining area and the service was horrible.

IQMmOOljpQvROiLQIkXWtw.text: loved the place. food was delicious. my bartender Ian was amazing!!! definitely a must when in Vegas.

6SSFbExN5zrg9LBhK72CEA.text: I would love to say this is 3.5 stars.  The trendy atmosphere and downtown locale will make a great spot for a business lunch or dinner. It is relatively easy to find and get to, but you will likely pay for parking (think about $1 per hour). The tables were clean and tidy, along with the rest of the dining area.   The prices are more than fair and you can see the effort in their presentation of the meals. We ordered the crispy wings, not necessarily traditional, but they were crispy, flavorful, and tender inside. The traditional spring rolls were fresh but bland. The peanut sauce served along side it was slightly too sweet, but others loved it.  Now... for the pho! The soup came in a clay pot with the usual fresh basil, mung beans, jalapeno, and limes. This plate was freshly cut and chilled for a zesty compliment to the broth. The noodles were perfectly cooked and the broth was not overly salted. They only have siracha as a chili sauce - but order a side of it if you like your pho a little spicy - as theirs can seem pale compared to more traditional resturants. I'm sure pickier eaters will do well with this version of pho of they have not liked it in the past.  Service was great even with this being a 'soft' opening. Our server was accomodating, friendly, and let us be during most of our meal.

FY7vt9fa679mZJ1Oas0wcA.text: Decor 10/10, happy hour 10/10, service 10/10   This place rules. It's been difficult to find a solid Pho spot that doesn't have metallic-looking beef, yet here we are. Happy hour includes oysters, chicken or veggie/vegan pho, drink specials and more. Plus it's all absolutely delicious. LOVE IT!

nWVHQtecOwcTt81R05awbg.text: Great atmosphere, great service from Jasmine and great food. Drove by and thought I would check it out since I love Vietnamese food. It was just me, I really wanted the spring rolls, but being by myself the rolls and an entree would be too much. I ordered the pho dip bahn mi. Tasty meat and vegetables in a crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside roll. The combination of flavors were great. It was served with a small bowl of pho to dunk in and some shrimp chips (imagine pork rinds with a shrimp flavor) They were good, but not something I would crave. I wish the sandwich was served with a small spring roll. Looking forward to going back and yes I will order spring rolls and take what is leftover home with me.

CgmnMOLAf5fMYwbk6HV8OA.text: First, it's nice having so many options available downtown now.  As a table we ordered the Ginger Chicken, Pork Vermicelli Bowl, egg rolls and BBQ Pork .  Some of the pork from the bowl was sent back to be cooked further.  Overall, all the dishes were good.  Personally, I prefer the value and atmosphere at their sister restaurant, District One.  Jasmine, our waitress, split our bill three ways without even asking, probably used to the work lunch crowd.  On a negative note two of us paid cash and she thought it was acceptable to keep the change and only return our bills.  I don't think this is okay and to me it's basically stealing so I'm not a fan of that.

HJYWj3gK2U5hypxUz44m9w.text: Had lunch here Tuesday July 25th around 1pm. We sat at the bar. Although the rest of the (female) staff were nice, the (male) bartender was not nice or friendly. I always sit at the bar at restos and have eaten all over the country and world. He was by far the least friendly bartender I have ever had the displeasure of experiencing. He was short with a hefty dose of attitude. I hope the other bartenders are not like that bc we enjoyed the food immensely... Sweetie had oxtail pho, I had duck noodles. Both were excellent. Tons of flavor. My only complaint on the duck noodles is the noodles were stuck together, making it more difficult to eat. Other than that I look forward to trying this spot again. Everything on the menu sounded delicious.

utFEW6Whsd1xKeHhLh39LQ.text: We came on a Sunday evening. Parking seemed really simple and it was free. However, during the week it will cost money and be more difficult. The restaurant is located under the juhl. The block/neighborhood reminds me of New York City and I love it.   It was happy hour (even on Sunday)! We sat at the bar and were greeted by a friendly bartender who got us waters upon seating (super attentive and we didn't have to ask). I ordered tequila shots and my friend ordered a cucumber mule... which was prepared so perfectly, it made my heart happy.   We ordered the vegan spring rolls, vegan pho, and the BBQ plate (not vegan). The rolls were tasty! I am not a huge fan of tofu, so I might as for strictly veggies next time. The pho was something that made my heart happy. It was so flavorful, full of veggies... and portion was large enough for two. It's perfect for the upcoming winter and I recommend vegans and non vegans alike order it! My boyfriend had the BBQ plate and loved it. I can't really say much about it, other than he finished the whole Thing with a big smile.   I can't wait to go back to le pho. I may even have an afternoon there with my laptop and turn it into a working lunch!

Checked in here to redeem the bogo green Thai ice tea.  the price for one is pretty expensive. It's $5. My friend and I ordered the diy platter spring roll and the house special pho and we shared everything. It was delicious. The pho bowls are pretty big and they give you plenty of meat. I like how they give you more meat than noodles for the pho. Other places usually go cheap on the meat and give you more noodles. The broth for the pho was good as well. I liked the protein given in the diy platter. Shrimp was good as well. Definitely will come back for happy hour and to try their other dishes.

RFfpuJ3LEj0pOBNjhrx7Fg.text: Cute n chic Viet fusion joint at the Juhl. Came in on a coincidence as the wife and I were looking for a quick lunch before our movie started... came in during happy hour (not sure when they start and end, but we came in at 3PM) they had 5$apps n half priced selected pho (chicken or vegies) I had the chicken pho which came out to be $4.50... we started with a signature appetizer called the le pho roll which is a stir fried pork wrapped in a rice noodle, then we had the salt and pepper wings (6 pieces). pEshF5aQ-CgG3Z71ccWbew.text: I've been wanting to try this spot since they opened. I'm a huge fan of their other spot, District One. I follow the Le Pho Instagram account and the food looks so appetizing. I'm also Vietnamese so I've been eating Vietnamese food all my life. It is my absolute favorite cuisine, for obvious reasons. With that said, I am always excited to try new Vietnamese spots.  I love the hip and urban feel of Le Pho. It's smaller than District One, but the decor is a similar feel. It's a cool space. The service was excellent. The food was good.

u2mUAzq8w_gEqshJfhdRVw.text: Food was good although the rice had a spice I've never had on fried rice that I did not like. It's a cool new space with a bar. I give it 3 stars because the service was not good. We were left unattended for a very long time.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hSuLLt5ApZ8xtIzJBLUwbg.text: Went in at 9pm on a Wednesday night. Place was nearly empty; maybe just couple other customers besides us three.  Server was very nice and polite. Food was however very disappointing...  Waited 20 minutes for two orders of pho and one vermicelli !! Both pho had super salty broth; my supposedly raw beef slices were cooked to well done :(  All the meats in the vermicelli were tasteless... Tasteless!!  I didn't finish my pho; ordered duck noodle right away as I did not like my pho at all.... another 20 minutes later the duck noodle came out....  Again unbelievably salty lol no other flavors but saltiness was detected... we just laughed then paid our bill and left...

kPHLF23YZi8jnV8_0XsKPA.text: This place is delicious! Would recommend to anyone looking for a great Pho restaurant. Will definitely come back!

T-f-Gc_bfAQt590VaxLIvA.text: I'm from LA and was in Vegas for this past weekend. Had to come back twice. Had the ribeye pho the first time, so good. Next day I tried the oxtail pho, just as good. The broth was savory and delicious. A little fatty but not overwhelming. Staff was super friendly. Didn't expect it to be that great low key because I'm kind of spoiled with pho here, but definitely will try to stop by next time I'm in Vegas.

IAh2j7cTSQBEjrKJ4vxX5w.text: This was the best Vietnamese food I ever had so far. The food was great and I loved the ice cream ( taro)

EZyLxh_scdIEQmWk0OpxHg.text: Be aware!! When you check in through Yelp it says free green thai ice tea, but it's actually a buy 1 get 1 free so make sure you don't get fooled by this stupid promo. It's a small glass of iced sweeten green tea (nothing special) which they charge for $5 and I honestly think it's worth about $1. If you're looking for authentic Thai or Viet place, skip this one!! The food was either too sweet or bland. Plus the service was really slow.

90A2Dgp406iqu6zW-BJY4w.text: Everything we got was deliciois and we practically ordered half the menu. You really cant go wrong. The ginger checken was full of flavor, bahn mi was bangin. Spring rolls are better than most ive had. Bio Bia were the best spring rolls ever!!! Great overall experience for everyone in my party. New favorite pho spot!

DqhtCHbtAhpLwEwPRL-Ecw.text: I have never in my life finished an order of Pho. I can no longer say that now that I've had Pho from Le Pho!   I discovered Pho about 10 years ago in Denver and regularly went all over the area looking for and enjoy great Pho. Since I moved here 4 years ago I have tried a few times but have been disappointed so often that I kinda gave up. Tonight though I was really craving Pho and decided to give this place a try. I had also read about their Phi Dipped, which is a Bahn Mi twist on a French Dip so it's made with Roast Beef but you dip it in Pho Broth. So I decided that I'd order both and just eat HALF the Pho. So much for that...  Pho Dipped - When I got the sandwich home I took a quick bite and was blown away instantly with how tasty it was. The bread was perfect and the flavors were great. I then dipped it into the Pho Broth. Words really don't give it justice! I have been also searching for a decent French Dip in this town and this may be my new go to sandwich. I can say that nothing I learned in etiquette classes was used eating that sandwich. I only regret not order two  I then finally got to my Pho. I got the special which has Ribeye, Tenderloin, Flank, Tripe, and Meatballs. Yum Yum Yum! The broth is so tasty that I barely added any spice or soy, which I almost always have to dump both into to add flavor. All the meat was super tasty and the noodles were perfect  I have to say I'm now a total fan. Next time I get a craving or Pho or Bahn Mi, I'm definitely coming back here

fFr43kyY0OsCL1LcjyT4cg.text: I may or may not live in the vicinity, But I'll tell you that this place is awesome!  I'm a fan of le Thai and district one  So of course I had to check it out.  I've come many times already in different days and different times of the day. For the most part I have come when it's pretty quiet. Which I prefer. The staff are always friendly and attentive.  I have even ordered take out and it was promptly made as communicated.   My favorite is their French dip banh mi sandwiches. It's the best of both worlds when I can never decide what I want. I'm still not sure how I feel about their taro chips that come with it as I have never tried them other than here.   Are they suppose to Taste burnt ? Not sure. Either way it's great to have something different in downtown. Recommend this place highly wish they had those yummy buns from district one.

u6nVxzy4XKHcLbMhZbUF6Q.text: I absolutely love pho and have given this place many tries, but Le Pho is always such a disappointment. Overall, the menu and prices are pretentious, the broth flavor is lacking and the banh mi has been sold out on a couple of occasions, regardless if it's lunch or dinner. The saving grace was the unique item of the oxtail pho, but lately the preparation has been less than desirable. On the most recent occasion, a live rolly polly was crawling around the mint leaves for the fried egg roll appetizer, solidifying a one-star rating and ensuring I'll never be back.

whaaAVMM1d1ugslmWiajpw.text: back for more house pho, so good, hot, fresh and under $15, I'll be coming back for more and more

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House pho to go! The best, to die for! Fast, fresh and really hot, so the meat cooks thorough. Definitely coming back again,

bdyKMJR8PyCxCNX6LBuQJg.text: Place is pretty good..average price like $11-$14..big serving for sure. They gave us military discount so that was nice the only complain I have is that they charge $3 for extra broth. Waitress was kinda annoyed when we asked to separate our broth from our noodles. Umm not our first time taking pho home duh!  Overall will come back and maybe try the other fusion items they have on the menu.

mnlFt5Sk_iGekQ47Si6hNw.text: Service n food are good. But the hostess didn't  know what she was doing. We had to sit by ourselves. The bartender was awesome and he took care of us.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lotus roots salad. 4 pieces for $10

WcdmD5p7nGjnaIylHONZqw.text: I'm not a vegan, but I like to eat that way from time to time and I like it when restaurants can make it great. Honestly, most vegan pho I've had has been very bland until now. Usually tastes like boring vegetable soup. The vegan pho here is right on track, tastes very Vietnamese. Best vegan pho I've had now. The vegan spring rolls were excellent, too. They have fried tofu, shiitake mushrooms, and mint in it. I also had the oysters (excellent) and the poached chicken salad has a light fish sauce vinaigrette which was delicious. I would order everything I tried again. *contented tummy pats*

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LuO2Djxslk5roVLJb4e4JQ.text: Great taste but DTLV prices. I prefer Pho Rancho as it is more budget friendly and closer to home but if you are down town definitely come here for the food and a cocktail.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye pho and bahn mi pho dip

DytrFojkWKwzCX_o7LjvBA.text: Best Pho place I've had since moving to Las Vegas! I had a favorite place back in Washington State and I couldn't find any just as good until Le Pho. Not only is the food really good, but the amount; that was the first time I couldn't finish a bowl of Pho. My family and I came here for my birthday and the employees were so accommodating and nice. It probably helped because they were local (from Hawaii). They also brought out a HUGE piece of cake and Ube ice cream for me. Seriously, this place is awesome and definitely recommend it to Pho lovers and anyone just looking to relax and dine.

lb__V-grVWwqvxa_YduMqg.text: One of my new favorite Vietnamese restaurants in Vegas! Great vibe and super friendly staff. The food was on point too! I highly recommend the Banh mi that comes with a small side of pho as a dipping sauce!! Best Banh Mi I've ever had by far! The Bio Bia spring rolls were also delicious with, simple yet very flavorful with amazing textures and fresh ingredients! Lotus root salad is also a must! So many pleasant surprises here. I can't wait until the whole menu is available and I definitely expect to be coming here often.

a9N2MZqTLDh1kBFexCtXhA.text: Pho is my "go to" when I'm hungover, and let me tell you, THIS IS THE BEST PHO I'VE EVER HAD. I had the ribeye and flank pho. The meat was very tender; it completely melts in your mouth! The broth is so flavorful and just delicious. Diamond our waitress was so sweet and very helpful. zGxR-jniKFGLXCDuPB25uw.text: Wish i could give 0 stars.. Walked in seat yourself had a party of 5 there was a reserved table big enough to accommodate and an open table for 4. YxrmAJyjxo9RKngBdu07xQ.text: Great! It's at the base of my apartment building, so it's quite easy to stop in for a quick-ish bite. They have a great assortment of food and a solid staff. There has been nothing here that I have not thoroughly enjoyed, so I will just say that you can't go wrong with ordering anything on the menu.  Why not five stars, you ask? To me, it deserves only a solid four stars because it is missing that "something special." The food is good, but not "wow" good. So, a solid four stars it is.

hlv2PyItXaOg8TZrp7eAgw.text: Nom nom nom, I love Le Pho! This place is easily one of my favorite downtown spots, seeing as I crave it at random. They have an awesome menu filled with affordable dishes for just about everyone, including vegan and gluten-free options. My personal fave is the ribeye pho - however, I'd always suggest getting a bahn mi sandwich just to dip into the broth if you can - they even have a sandwich + broth combo already on the menu if that'd be something you're interested in. So yummy!

I tought the pieces of ribeye were too long and big...kinda hard to work them with chopsticks. Still was good enough and prices were nice. I made a quick stop before heading to Downtown...its a 10min walk.

Lastly they need more onion in the pho.  The add on items are nice but not needed if the meat if these items were just corrected.

cWkkoSg-NpUR3LbzWSR50Q.text: My boyfriend and I went here last night for dinner. And the food was really good. Oxtail pho was really good and the service was great! We'll definitely will go back to this place.

O3z_TalKizGqyTqJOWxXCA.text: One of the best meals I've had in a long time, I only wish they had this place where I live. It's casual, affordable, and the food is incredible! It's off the strip, you can get there for $9-12 Uber ride, it's pretty close to downtown Freemont Street.  Well worth the trip. Try the Pho Dipped is a banh mi which is made with brisket served with pho broth for dipping, it's a Vietnamese version of a French dip. So creative and so delicious! I'd also recommend the pho rolls as a starter, which comes with pork wrapped in flat rice noodles and is served with a fish sauce for dipping. Also really tasty!
