zt9yjF6CqM9K2-4-fJRr4A.text: Food on point and consistent. Service real good!  Chicken pho, wings, and their rolls were great!

HC3NsG_ytK-4_S9-LCa-0g.text: I really love this place for Shrimp Pho. However, Jasmine the server should probably work elsewhere. She is not nice. She moves so quickly you feel like you can't sit and enjoy your food. 3 min after we receive our Pho she came and asked if we needed boxes. Slow down! Next the hot tea situation here is thumbs down. They brought it out with a sake cup. Can I get a tea cup ma'am? When I asked Jasmine about a regular sized tea cup she proceeds to tell me that's what Asian people use. BYE. Is this real life? She then tells me she will order some tea cups. Should have had those on opening day. Oh, I forgot to mention that my tea although in the fancy "Asian" tea pot was cold. We asked  Jasmine for napkins at the beginning of service, and I can go home shower make some hot tea, and still no napkins. Every other server here is amazing. They were very friendly and kind. If you come here make sure not to get Jasmine. Your dinner will be a 10 min. disaster.

kRjhuoT0pvPSZKPs9AqHxA.text: Tasty, a bit of Asian fusion cuisine, the right portion. The server was  pleasant and yet sort of distant. We were 5 people in our party. We ordered 2 vermicelli bowls, one for me, they were better of what we expected. My other friends ordered pho soup, 2 chicken (Not the traditional style which my friends mentioned that "it's like a cup of noodles...", generic and somehow "flavorless". Another plate of rib eye pho, according to my friend "it was delicious and filling". Some dishes are over priced such as the Spring and Egg Rolls and the Oxtail fried rice that it was requested for take out. I'll go back again and order the Vermicelli bowl again.

I've tried their banh mi and only the chicken pho. The pho is huge and tasty. I'll def order their banh mis again esp because there arent any other places downtown that offer it. I'm obviously not an expert - this place may not be the most authentic but the flavors are definitely there. The happy hour menu looks great and I've been meaning to come back for it!

z5ufkIpNSDIfp5tMhmiN-Q.text: Really enjoyed the food I don't eat vietnamiens that often. My wife and her friend ordered the pho, ox tail, delicious. My friend had garlic noodles with chicken he says they were fantastic. I had the rib eye bah mi, most excellent. We had drinks before hand the same really great. And pricing reasonable. But beware no one under 21, another big plus for me anyhow.  Also big shut out to our server Richard very delightful!

Ql0ZELUYWrM6OTboT3ISWw.text: I came here with my boyfriend this Sunday around noon. We were seated promptly and had our orders taken. It wasn't that packed at first but then the lunch rush started trickling in. It took them about 30 min to bring out our appetizers and 45 min to bring out our entrees. I know it's busy but when you see other parties that have arrived after you, receive multiple dishes before you even get any of your food, you can't help but start to feel upset. Really how long does it take to fry French fries? They don't even have soup spoons for you to sip your pho. I was barely able to sip any of my soup because of this. On top of that it's taken them 10 minutes to get the check back to us.   TLDR: you're better off going to a different place where you don't have to pay $12 for a bowl of pho and you get your food within 10 minutes of ordering. The food was decent but not amazing, definitely not worth the value or wait.

Gak9z0mdvd_XsPn7sRPfhw.text: Good pho broth, very clean Broth..they just need to cut the rib eye slices! We had to keep cutting them and they were so tuff and chewy...it wasn't in the broth for hours other wise it would of been super tender.

FZQ5okQBF1Tex6MPjdtUtw.text: It was quite chilly on our morning walking tour of downtown; what would be better than a hot bowl of soup? This place was busy, a good sign, and we had to wait a few minutes for a table. We ordered some traditional spring rolls and Saigon buffalo wings to share and each of us selected the house special pho. The starters came out quickly. The spring rolls were great! The wings were kind of scrawny and seemed over cooked; the buffalo sauce was delicious and VERY spicy, too hot for civilians, but not good enough to rescue the dish. The pho was the biggest disappointment. First, the ratio of ingredients was not what any of us expected; lots of tendon, little ribeye, no tripe. The jalapeno slices were plentiful, but looked bad and we had to ask for more fresh basil so all three us got some. The ratio problem might be forgiven except that it was overshadowed by the completely lackluster broth. Mostly flavorless, we asked for some fish sauce on the side, but no amount of fish sauce or sriracha could generate enough umami to bring it home. We can't imagine what any of the other pho offerings not billed as "special" would be. One of the others in our party liked something about the meal and begged me to add one more star, so I did.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9Qh1ZhFfbMe9-PUxEF5FyA.text: Family and I came in for lunch.  I had been here several times.  It was wife's and son's first time.  Really bad experience overall.  Will not be back.  Greeted by hostess...she was very pleasant and seated us very quickly.  Our server took a little while to get to us, but the lunch crowd was at it's peak.  Overall, the server was very slow, and did not know about one of the ingredients on the menu.  I thought that was surprising because the menu is not very big.  This server was not very attentive, and throughout the meal, not to be found.  At one point, another server and the hostess helped us out. I do have to say that the server did get us one comped drink and comped fries (because it was forgotten in our orders.)  We ordered sweet lime soda, green thai tea, BBQ Pork Banh Mi, Ginger Chicken, and the Pho Dipped ($50).  The "sandwiches" were both horrible.  Like I mentioned, I had been here several times, and this was by far the worse food I have had here.  The sandwiches were sloppy and the plate itself had no presentation.  The broth was ok.  My wife said her Ginger Chicken was good, but she could not taste any ginger.  It was served with a bed of white rice.  She tried to have me taste her food, but I was so disappointed with mine that I refused.  It's a shame that this place has gotten worse, in my opinion.  Downtown needs lunch spots.  Will not return, and I don't recommend.

c9T5eTpBrV4UsqJRqR_BTA.text: The pho was good, nothing crazy to rave about but not bad either. It hit the spot. He ordered oxtail pho, I ordered oxtail rice with a fried egg on top. My fried rice was so good I was shoveling that into my mouth and finished it in like five minutes. The food was good...   But oh my God the service was awful. We went in and there was nobody in the restaurant but one other table and one person at the bar. There was a bartender and one server. Our food took so long to come out and I didn't understand why because there was only one other table of twoZ I don't know if it was a cook or the server I don't wanna blame just the server, I could've been the cook, BUT Just to get our check we were sitting there forever before he came to check on us. We spent the whole time saying that we should've just ordered it for pick up.

__sA8D75ObE_rHKgWzINJQ.text: Non working phone, rude ass employees Tried to give this place a second chance and seriously it's absurd.

d1DuVrmi8wHbXB0Hxx_sQQ.text: This place looks beautiful on the inside. Very modern and clean. The people are friendly and attentive. There's a full bar available and a few draft beers. There is a vegan Bahn mi and a vegetarian pho option. I ordered the vegan bahn mi it was super good but after awhile the amount of ginger and garlic was overwhelming. I tasted it for the rest of the day. The bf got the pho dip, very flavorful but the meat was tough and very chewy. They didn't use the thin sliced meat that comes in the pho. The reason he enjoyed it so much is because the flavor was there.

bOx2FW1glzjKMqC6yHMMsQ.text: Dropped by here for lunch before hitting up the outlets, we ordered the pho rolls, veggie pho, and house special. The pho rolls tasted like banh cuon (flour roll dish) and the broth for the house pho was awesome. My only setback was the service. The server was rude and seemed confused every time we tried to wave him down for something. Although I don't visit Vegas that often, I wouldn't drop by again.

E_MFV-aW1cUHKk1DvvgSZQ.text: This place was sooooo fire!! The beef watercress was my favorite, and it is a dish I would come back for. We also ordered the DIY spring rolls, the shrimp in those were perfectly seasoned. The green Thai iced tea tasted like a root beer float. The service was top notch. Michelle was super helpful with giving recommendations, and she was very attentive to all of our requests. Next time we're out in Vegas, we'll be stopping in here. Thanks Le Pho!

RbeNrBHAwmmZeAKWudAajg.text: I came to this place as I was perusing downtown LV. It was a bit chilly outside so I knew some pho would be good. I was immediately greeted and told to take a sit wherever I wanted. I sat next to the bar and was given the menu quickly. I was so impressed with their happy hour menu! They had so many options, including chicken and vegetable pho for less than $4.50. WHAT! I ordered the chicken pho and hoped for the best. They also had 12oz beers (Miller, coors) for $2.   To my surprise the pho was very tasty! It had a lot of chicken and noodles. The broth was flavorful too. For the price paid during happy hour there is no way I can complain. I highly recommend visiting then (I believe it is from 4-7pm).   THIS restaurant is only for people 21 and over!!! No minors allowed! Just thought I would point it out since they have a sign inside that says this.

They also had bottomless mimosas which were a hit. I loved the Hangover Pho and the meatballs were so good.  Love it.  See photos of what our group ordered.  Wish this was in Summerlin. n8bdz0nh7hQcL-3pfxBBfA.text: I went here with my coworker for lunch. The place itself is beautiful and we loved the atmosphere. However, our waiter was a bit slow...  My coworker ordered the fries and the soda- she didn't receive that at all. It wasn't even on the check itself though we both heard her order it.  We had to ask for chopsticks and napkins as we didn't get those with our order. With the napkins, I had to get up to go looking for them myself as the waiter didn't come over to us too much- I felt like we were forgotten...  The food itself was pretty good though! It was the first time my coworker had Pho and loved it. I just wish she was able to receive the fries she ordered and the soda as well.  I want to go back. Hopefully, next time we won't be forgotten so much.

5OaQbVJptKIzQuLQ8uyckg.text: I wanted to love this place, but there was a lot left to be desired.   I was shopping around the North Premium Outlets and had an intense craving for pho. Instead of traveling to Chinatown, my handy dandy yelp app lead me here  (and less than 10 minutes away from the outlets - wooo!)  I ordered their house special pho, nem nuong, egg rolls, grandma's grilled pork, and the bbq plate.   Combination pho definitely satisfied my craving!  A little on the expensive side when you're paying $12 for pho though.   Nem nuong was not worth it, at all. I guess I was expecting something along the lines of Brodards style and I did not get anything like it. I felt like I was eating a spring roll full of lettuce and mint. The pork patty was non-existent and there was no crunchy wonton inside! I was so disappointed.   Egg roll was decent. A little on the small side and I feel the fish sauce was much needed to pump up the flavor.   Grandma grilled pork was recommended by the hostess and she said it was different than the pork found in their BBQ plate. Though their flavors are different, I enjoyed the BBQ plate pork more. Grandma's grilled pork was too salty for my family. And even though I know it's an appetizer, it was tiny. I think there was about 6 pieces of pork in the appetizer.   The BBQ plate was delicious and filling. Comes with pork and short ribs, rice, and topped with an egg. I think this meal has the most bang for your buck. The only thing that was missing was the fish sauce you pour all over the meal. I'm used to doing that at other Vietnamese restaurants, but maybe they don't do it here.   I also think it's crazy that they make you pay extra for the scallion oil and other add ons that are included for free at other establishments.   I really wanted to love this place since I love Viet Noodle Bar and District One, but Le Pho sadly falls short of the other two.

h5Y_16cdZ_8ixkA5PV4XHA.text: LOVE LE PHO ROLLS!!! My favorite!  Definitely recommend Le Pho! The Le pho rolls are my favorite!! I crave them all the time! Not only is the food good the atmosphere and energy feels good! Out of all the times we've been there, this time around we got to meet a really cool guy Robert! He was an awesome server and bartender! Very attentive and personable! So fun to talk to! We always go back for the food and now will also be back for the awesome service!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail Pho
Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le Pho Rolls

4Ez7nbAdwehv0JQMqyyj8g.text: This place was okay. I think they get so busy they aren't so tentative to the tables. We had to walk up to them and ask for silverware and refills. We all drank water so we just asked them for a pitcher since it seemed like forever just to get a refill.

xQK2ThFBdag07aqEPcGECA.text: For the most part, I basically only write 1 and 5 star reviews on Yelp.  Le Pho was definitely worthy of a write up from me in the good way.  My wife and I stopped in las night and were completely happy with the food and service.  We were immediately pleasantly greeted and seated by the host who upon hearing it was our first time, gave us her suggestions of what to look for on their menu.  We took her advice on the appetizer and ordered what are eyes landed on for pho, the ox tail and ribeye.  Starting with the Le Roll, it was a great take on the traditional Vietnamese spring roll.  We loved the new approach and of great flavors and presentation while still keeping the essence of the dish.  As we were very hungry walking in, and because it was so good, the appetizer did more than its job by raising our anticipation for our main course.  I had ox tail and my wife the ribeye pho.  Admittedly having a little less finesse with chop sticks as I would like, my clumsy self was able to separate the succulent meat from the submersed bone with ease.  The small effort was completely worth the energy spent the instant I had that first taste of ox tail, pho noodle and broth.  I devoured my entire bowl with each mouthful producing my audible satisfaction.  My wife's response was equally as satiating.  With each initial morsel enjoyed, we'd have those exchange of glances as to wordlessly express "I know right?!?".  Being that she has a smaller stomach than me, she was not able to finish her portion, which I had no problem with... More food for me!!!  Having quickly finished my bowl, I was only happy to make sure we got our money's worth and made her dinner disappear.  Though more traditional of a pho than the ox tail, it was still a super tasty execution that shouldn't disappoint any pho enthusiast.  Ultimately we ordered a flan for dessert to end everything on a sweet note.  Which ended up being the perfect end to the meal.  The flan was light and custardy as opposed to dense or over drenched in syrup.  It was bouncy on our spoons and everything a flan should be.  And ultimately, it just the right sweetness to be the last flavors we took away from our visit.  We were very happy with our visit to Le Pho and will absolutely be back again! The food and service was awesome and when downtown craving a newer expressive take on Vietnamese food, we know where we will be going!

P2Ac53Cr0VhQEBAZoB718Q.text: This place just opened around 2 months ago.  It's owners of le Thai and district one. Two amazing restaurants. I had the vegetables pho. I have tried most pho Places in town and this might be the best so far.  Fresh, clean delicious broth and fixings. I will update next time I go.

dmqRyx64jO5cQ2vfgFs0CA.text: Vegan spring rolls awesome best peanut sauce.Visiting here from Fort Lauderdale would consider moving here just for the food

VSfQb7p-A0Iw6TB2vE-9lA.text: Everytime I go here, it never disappoints. Beautiful decor (downtown hip, trendy with a south east flair). Service is always impeccable (sat at the bar and bartender was great  and servers at the tables are super helpful and chose out great recommendations from the menu). Food took some time to come out (not too long), but when it did, it was devoured in seconds.   My favorites have to be: -nem nuong rolls -le pho rolls -pho (personally, I think Le Pho and District One make the best pho broth in town) -pho dipped sandwich -banh mi (again, I think their banh mi is the best in Vegas--and that's coming from a Vietnamese-American person) -lotus root salad -oysters  They also have daily specials on the board that are pretty spectacular as well. I missed out when had the banh beo, but I'm hoping on my baby prayers they'll do them again.

RrLoNiyepAiTsIsqRdG9Rg.text: When I'm ever in a town not LA I try one Vietnamese pho house. There are others in LV and I've tried a couple of others, but the food here is tops. It's not your typical Vietnamese pho house because it's really a sports bar. And maybe that's why the food is so good. Drinking food. For sure. The menu is small and that's a good thing. Many pho houses have menus that are pages long and have more than one hundred items. What you order here is what you'd order at any other pho house. The restaurateur has just simplified it for you. Others have pointed out their favorite dishes so I won't do that. You can order anything knowing it will be good.

hUTJIFkiUvEJz3dV3ZZJbw.text: Very good egg rolls ! The beef pho is the best.  I also enjoy the chicken pho option.  Stick with the soups and egg rolls you won't be disappointed. I always eat at the bar it's made out of some wicked wood. Still to try the sandwiches...

gxXbHse1runLA4C8e51GOA.text: Amazing place ! The food is incredible and the atmosphere of the place is very mellow.  Service was very good and the staff was very polite.  Definitely coming back whenever I get the chance

ZarWhbxqjoJzL9FrW2gkZw.text: The waitress was nice. Enough with the good, let's get to the pho. It wasn't good at all, if it wasn't for the Sriracha and hoisin sauce I just don't if I could have taken the few bites I did. I am almost certain I will never come back, nothing about it was good. Also, I ask for fever tree ginger ale and was bought a brand of ginger ale I never heard of. Disappointment all around

fEj9bgp2H-hLjMR4puD8hg.text: This place is awesome! A must go, and be sure to order le pho roll. I haven't seen this dish allot of other places and it's great. Also great Japanese whiskey selection. Good service and quick

udSoMFDvq9DXeSCZdJ3NUw.text: Great service. Yummy, tasty fresh, well-made food. Had the house special sandwich and the sandwich with pho broth. Served with crispy chips.   Nice craft beers on tap!  We definitely plan to return!!!

8XpLhar8SUPZBNIb2uq_rA.text: This place hits the spot on the right amount of coziness and convenience. There's low lighting and multi-level seating. It's not too loud and there is soft music playing overhead. The music is not intrusive (which means you can hold a conversation comfortably) so bring a date or enjoy your lunch break here in peace.   We've been hit with this cold front that just won't quit and I can't think of a better way to warm up than with a big steaming bowl of pho.   My coworker recommended this restaurant to me and it was a hit. We ordered the ribeye pho for $10.00 each. Once the broth hit the table, I added jalapenos, lime, sprigs of fresh basil,  and chili sauce to let them infuse flavors right away.   The noodles are tender yet springy enough to grip with chopsticks. The flavor from the fresh meat and crisp veggies meld into the broth so much so that you can sip the remaining liquid and still taste the complex combination of savory, citrusy, goodness.   I opted to drink their hot green tea, which is served in a petite, yet heavy, cast iron kettle. Careful, the whole pot is hot to the touch. The handle is narrow and it's a little awkward trying to pour the tea into little ceramic cups.   The service was prompt. We were acknowledged right at the door, asked where we preferred to be seated, and taken care of quickly. The wait staff is friendly and helpful. In other words, if you are a novice to pho, these people won't make you feel inferior. Ask away and enjoy experience!

3JRAwkUWrFtUGzQHzB1yNA.text: The vibe here is not like the traditional pho restaurant which is refreshing and different! The decor is modern with a mix of traditional. They have a bar and the lighting here is soft and not too harsh.  The noise level is average - background conversations seem like blurs but you can still talk to your party and hear them well. The menus are on a cork board, adding to the quirkiness and uniqueness of the atmosphere. The walls had art of Vietnam, which I enjoyed seeing, and everything was very well organized, even the bathroom was clean and nice.   Before we walked in, you could already smell the pho broth outside the restaurant.   This place has prices that's a little more expensive than other pho places that I've been to but you can definitely taste quality in their dishes. Their iced coffee drips so you can see the mixture of the condensed milk and coffee. It tastes so amazing - reminds me of the streets of Vietnam! It's not overwhelmingly strong but still has a rich taste to it.  I ordered the chicken pho and the broth was flavorful and the chicken not too tough. Our server, Jasmine, was polite and attentive, I love her nose ring. Jasmine explained the menu to us with confidence! She always checked up on us and talked to us in a friendly manner. Definitely recommend this place if you're in the area! It's closer to the Strip than Chinatown.   The restaurant continued to be kind to us even after we paid for our meals. They were so sweet to us that they gave us two flan desserts, courtesy of the chefs. This is a spot that I indeed plan on making a return. Thank you, Jasmine, chefs, and staff, for making this a great first experience!

hat-O6fZGns_DBwkV9Koww.text: Nice renovation, modern and fusion. I love pho! Soup was salty :( both chricken and beef taste almost the same. service was good!

3ulSwmyH_IOwpOt6PNytFA.text: Well. Mixed review here.  The food tastes good, and it's a cute little spot.  But the service was horrible. I had to ask for my server after waiting 10 minutes to be greeted. Food took awhile to be served; and when it was, I wasn't asked if I wanted anything else. I had to call another server over for bean sprouts and jalapenos...and had to ask 3 times for siracha sauce. I've never been served pho without basic bean sprouts and jalapenos.   Has great potential. But they really REALLY have to step their service game up. One last note, they were skimpy on the noodles. I'm used to tons and tons of noodles in my pho. I ran out of noodles before I finished the meat.

zGsLyiulxLvCGLL0l4NKRQ.text: I had the best sandwich of my life here. This place really is amazing! I ordered the vegan sandwich and I was so impressed and surprised! I will definitely be coming back!!

4wKS_wRY4l9FwJSxDqLm-w.text: What the Pho??!!  On a nondescript corner somewhere between the strip and downtown, in a place without the casino foot-traffic of flip-floppy marble-walkers or downtown project coolsters, and in the midst of Bail Bonders, court-goers and Juhlers, you'll find this very rough diamond of a restaurant.  With its pedigree and good chef, one would expect it to be more memorable than it is.  After all, following the Subway-ization strategy that has infected pizza places and burrito joints of late, it has a spring roll bar (sounds like something you'd put on race car in April, doesn't it?).  I mean come on; a bar where they make spring rolls is cool, right?  But even that doesn't quite work because it's in the back, out of sight, not in the front, so you lose the pleasure of marveling over the careful construction of the food you're about to consume.   And the treble-in-paradise acoustics of the room can only be described as Keith Moon doing an extended solo on your eardrums!  (For anyone under the age of 50, google "Keith Moon", dammit!)  The core problem is that the menu is as slim as a runway model and almost as simple-minded. I can barely remember what I ate! I think there was soup involved.  In a world where only special sells, and only spectacular lasts, none of that bodes well.

TGUnLoXPmMdinOI1IZ8Uig.text: I'm a Downtown Dweller and I'm very excited to have this restaurant in walking distance. It is even convenient when driving from work.   They offer quick  & easy take out - with an option to sit in their serene bar area while you wait. Convenient street parking is available.

9Rg8LoQjvbRl-dldA4WnRg.text: Everything was amazing! We ordered the pho house special, my hubby ordered the oxtail pho, and we all split a chicken banh mi. Our waitress Michelle was so attentive and helpful during our whole meal- we def enjoyed her and the restaurant.   We normally do the routine- Pho Kim Long and all the other restaurants on Spring Mtn, but I'm gonna say it. Broth is everything to me, and Le Pho surpassed Pho Kim Long!   We will definitely be back!

8o-BPy_8tajLu05uhLgCAg.text: Starting with a dining room that was way too hot - 86f, to the hostess / waitress that insisted on sitting every new party by the table next to one another when there was plenty of open tables as the place was nearly empty. Food was at best OK, and when looking for authentic Pho feel free to skip this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice and toasty 86 degrees in the dining area. If you ever get cold in 110 outside weather.

hCT7G9wOc_I0l6XAqsfi2w.text: Stopped for lunch with some friends at Le Pho during the week.  There's currently construction on the street next to the restaurant, so it took me a minute to figure out where to park.  There is street meter parking as well as a parking garage nearby.  The place was hopping busy!  However service was great!  Started off with a BBQ ribs that were to die for!  Then tried the garlic noodles with beef.  Amazing flavor!  Define a place to come back to to try other menu items!

xiQFeBrm3OOA9hBCNvNdJA.text: Why did you get rid of your phone number?  I would eat here all the time and I had a need to call you and arrange a large catering order. I'm not going to drive all the way to downtown Las Vegas just to discuss this with you in person. Put your phone number back online so patrons can reach you.

XW4aIWuNyg8kpbxIbS9L_w.text: Just left this restaurant. Worst customer service.  They only had a couple of customers and were pretty much empty. I seen they had enough staff on hand.   Our waiter wasn't friendly from the start, we placed our order but he walked away before we were finished.   Our food came out wrong as my friend ordered light noodles but they gave me light noodles and not hers. Throughout our entire meal he never checked on us once, I had to walk around trying to find someone to order a soda. A guy from the bar area seen me looking for someone and he got up and brought a different waiter over. We asked for a soda and a to go container. The guy told our waiter and he then brought the container then took off and never returned.   I had to get up and find someone to ask if I can get my check and pay. I told the other waiter about our service and he didn't acknowledge or care, then our original waiter heard me complaining and laughed a little then had a big smile on his face. Not one time asked how anything was nor did he care. He is horrible at customer service.   I would never go again especially if waiter Richard A. Is there.   Management please watch your camera tape to see what im talking about.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DglZT17BBdRqObCwDjDUow.text: When you're stuck serving on jury duty, you naturally don't want to stay in the building the whole day. So during one of my lunches, I ventured out. It was during the time where Vegas was seeing snow so it was pretty chilly out. Nothing is better on a chilly day than a hot piping bowl of pho!   I was seated right away when I got to the establishment! Granted, I sat at the bar and there were plenty of seats but it still counts!   Le Pho is actually owned by the same people who own District 1 and Viet Noodle Bar. They also own Le Thai too I believe.   There is nothing out of the ordinary about their menu. It's pretty average and has all your usual Vietnamese dishes.  I wanted something cheap and warm but a lot of their prices are a bit higher than the local places. But what do you expect? You're Downtown!   I originally wanted some spring rolls but they almost cost as much as a bowl of chicken pho. So, I decided to go with their chicken pho instead. They actually give a good amount of chicken with their pho! Every piece of chicken was very tender! The noodles were good. The soup base didn't taste like a chicken soup base to me? Or maybe it's because of all the herbs they used that I can't tell? I've had chicken pho before and the soup bases are usually has more chicken taste to it.   Pretty decent food. It's quick! I originally would have given it a 3 stars since there is nothing particularly mind blowing or special about this place. Like, it wouldn't be my first choice for pho. However, the bartender that was waiting on me was really nice! He provided a nice conversation and was on top of everything! Great service and friendly so they get an extra star :)   Not a bad place to go if you're in the area and craving for some Viet food.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pho

s0cehmnID9eH7Z6oFJ1WsA.text: Used to come here all the time with my boyfriend, amazing food albeit slow service. They've had signs on their door all summer saying they were undergoing renovations so we waited. Unfortunately the last time we've tried to come despite saying open on yelp & google they are CLOSED no sign, no furniture, lights off. Don't waste your gas.

Yt91Ez-XuQ1k-_G9UDWgRA.text: I've driven by Le Pho for years and finally got a visit in...It's never too late to discover a solid pho joint...  Le Pho ambiance & service:  This is a very attractive restaurant with a contemporary industrial vibe.  Lots of wood, metal chairs, pendant lamps, and tall ceilings makes for a cool dining area.  There's a pretty  bar for the boozers and flat screens strategically placed throughout.  Our server was super friendly throughout our meal and his assistants were great with keeping the table clear. The kitchen got our appetizers and Pho bowls to the table timely.  Le Pho Cuisine:  I ordered the Spicey Chicken wings off the Happy Hour menu.  You get 5 pieces and they were pretty tasty.  I had the Ribeye Pho and it was on point.  The broth was savory, noodles were fresh and the ribeye was delish.  You get a pretty good serving of Pho at $11 a bowl so you're getting value.  They can definitely hold their own versus other Pho restaurants in the Vegas Valley.  Le Pho is another local business I'm more than happy to frequent when I'm in the area.  There's items on them menu I'd love to try on the another visit but that's another tale.  Enjoy!

4tQDnUJKfnpoRbGc1CxViA.text: 45 minutes for my oxtail pho to come out!  I had to get it to go because I only had a limited amount of time for a lunch break but am I getting bamboozled with this wait time?!    I took a picture of a semi empty restaurant too because I don't know if they went to the store to buy some oxtails.  But I only saw the server four times.  The four times were to take my order, drop off food, pick up check, drop off check.  I did destroy the pho when I went back to the office and it was delicious.  Maybe it was just this time where the stars didn't align but I went ahead and took care of the hostess too because they did more work that the server, even taking the pho back to put it in to go containers and getting the check for me.  I'd return here but I hope I don't get the same server, it seemed he may have still been upset of the lunch rush and took it out on me by doing the bare minimum.

IA-6FaYH53yKAPMi2TX0Ew.text: This is a super posh pho place with super posh prices. I happened to be passing by and was craving pho so decided to give it a shot. I sat at the bar and tried their ribeye  pho. The broth was underwhelming and it did not taste authentic.   The meat however melted in my mouth, and that may have been the best part of my meal.  Since there is no competition in the area, it's worth checking out, but I wouldn't walk in expecting authentic flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye pho

pJhgi8OBh8YthLMjsySO-A.text: Solid oxtail pho.  Soup came out piping hot and soup was not too salty... the 2 main items I always hope for in any pho!  This is a Vietnamese fusion spot located in downtown Vegas near the court house, with a bunch of surrounding drive through wedding chapels and people just "hanging out" and sleeping on the streets.  As I came to Le Pho for lunch, and it was broad daylight ... we never felt unsafe, but I can imagine it's a different story after dark.   We arrived around 1pm and were greeted by the friendly bartender asking us to feel free to sit anywhere.  Then very promptly the waiter (male w short pony tail) brought us water and menu.  He was courteous, efficient and very quick.  We both opted for the oxtail pho and shared an appetizer the Le Pho special roll.  Also ordered a BOGO green thai iced tea thanks to Yelp's check in perk.  Oxtail pho is solid with good broth (not too salty).  Oxtail was cooked perfectly -- moist and tender with a chew.  The meat did not just completely fell off the bone but required chewing off.  perfect!  The oxtail it's perfectly seasoned and each of our order received  4 pieces: 1 large, 2 medium and 2 small.  The pho was ok.  I wish it was fresher.  The Le Pho special roll was good.  Though the roll fell apart when picked up w chopsticks... that should never happen to a well made good roll.  The flavors were good and the key ingredient was the 5-spices pork which made the roll yummy .   The waiter is very seasoned and efficient... during our whole meal, he was solo on the floor and didn't miss a beat.  He checked on us during our meal and was never over bearing.  And somehow he came to us with the check towards the end of our meal at the perfect time!  amazing.    Overall great experience.  We came for the oxtail pho and it Le Pho came through for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D8V3TQ91NZqqyjpDRDp29A.text: Ehhhh, i've been eating pho for as long as I can remember.   I totally get that this is a downtown location and they are probably paying more rent than the chinatown folk so I do totally get it. But still at the end of the day ... its spring rolls pho and thai tea.   The thai tea being a hefty dollar sign as well, for something that taste ... interestingly overly sweet and slightly like mom's perfume.   I mean overall the food wasn't bad, and I was downtown at the time so it was convenient, but I just couldnt get over the bill for two bolls of soup some eggrolls and thai tea.

jCgiS7uVIJSm_Y01ZxEbRw.text: The menu and vibe at Le Pho reminds me of The Pig and the Lady. It's 15 min from the strip and 1 mile from the north outlets, a good stop before shopping. They are known for their ox tail dishes, le pho rolls, and their matcha Thai iced teas (buy one get one free with yelp check in).   Favorites: - ox tail fried rice - huge portion - poached chicken salad  Good - le pho rolls (steamed noodle roll with sausage) - combo pho (better at district one)  Meh - pho dip - bread was fresh but soggy and overall just didn't taste very good. Uses the brisket from pho needed to be thinly sliced.   Service was great, food was solid, if i lived nearby i could see myself frequenting often!

n8gjzapWyiGYR8ND6wQprw.text: LITERALLY THE BEST STIR FRY NOODLES I'VE HAD IN MY LIFE!  Not exaggerating. I came for lunch and ordered the garlic stir fry noodles with shrimp. Garlic goes great with anything, Le Pho perfected it. The restaurant is intimate. There is also a full bar. I like that there is a variety of options to choose from, not just pho noodles. They also cater to the vegan and vegetarian foodies out there. I want to go back for dinner!

rS-pg_rItPUPlBsfoIemLA.text: I really like the modern and trendy feel of this restaurant. It's clean and quaint and located downtown. The food definitely exceeded my expectations for such a trendy pho spot. I wasn't expecting authentic flavors, but their pho definitely took me by surprise!  I've had their pho which is really yummy and flavorful. Their pho roll appetizers and banh mi's are pretty good as well. They have a pretty good selection during happy hour. Looking forward to coming back to try their other dishes.

Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings
Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho rolls

jBbd5eLKqT7OC4QJTr5KoA.text: This adorable little place was between my hotel, the Golden Nugget, and the closest, (and best in my opinion,) dispensary in the area. Needless to say I drove by a few times, and because I live in a city that does not have a Pho restaurant, I knew that we were going to have to go there for dinner! Hands down the best Pho I've ever had, and absolutely loved the giant silver bowl it was served in!   We ordered some delicious little rolls before our dishes came, and in retrospect I wish I would have ordered two orders of those delicious, melt-in-your-mouth delights.  If you check-in, you get buy one get one free GREEN Thai Tea! Soooo good with all the flavorful food.

KcddL-4QJ9DOGZKUN1XBhA.text: Friday afternoon, I came home feeling lousy.  I've been fighting with allergies/a summer cold for a while now, and I was craving pho.   My incredible husband said that he wanted to take me to dinner and a movie, so I pulled up my trusty Yelp app and looked for Pho spots near us.    Le Pho was the closest with more than a 3 star rating, so we hopped in the car and drove down.  We're not really frequent visitors to the downtown area, but Le Pho was easy to find, and parking was also easy to find.  Not a huge fan of the "pay to park" meters, but at least we were able to park close by!  The spot is clean and open, and we were invited to sit anywhere we wanted.  Our server stopped over and gave us menus, and brought over water. She was super polite for the entire visit.  I wish I got her name.    When you check in on the Yelp app, there is a check in offer for a buy one get one free Iced green Thai tea.  I'd never had green Thai tea before, but this was delicious.  It had a very subtle sweet taste.  I'll definitely be having another one next time!  Happy hour is from 3-6, and we arrived at 4, so we were able to take advantage of one of the happy hour specials:  the Le Pho Roll for $4.    This is absolutely delicious.  grilled 5 spice pork, basil, and other amazingness wrapped up in a rice noodle textured wrapper...we had to let it sit and cool for a moment, but oh man was this delicious!!!  We also ordered the traditional spring roll, which had shrimp, pork, veggies, and noodles.  Perfection.  The peanut sauce was on point as well.  As for the entrees: Morgan had the oxtail pho.  The broth was a little salty due to the meat, but some herbs and sriracha fixed that right up. The oxtail was tender, and practically falling off the bone.  It was really good.  I had opted for the rib-eye pho, as it was the closes to the Pho Tai that i normally get.  This was exactly what I'd been craving.  The broth was so delicious, there was a TON of rib-eye meat in it, the noodles were cooked perfectly, and the addition of herbs and sriracha helped me to spice some of the sickness out. I actually have left overs for lunch today.  All in all, I was very pleased with our visit.   Service was great, and the food was phenomenal.  We both had 2 huge bowls of pho, 2 drinks, and 2 appetizers for under $50.  Not too shabby!!!  We will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye pho

Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QKg_etquMv4QWmcJE_-WvA.text: Stopped by Le Pho before leaving Vegas and it was the best decision. Parking: there was plenty of paid street parking around when my friend and I went. I'm not sure if there was a lot close by.  At first glance, Le Pho can be missed. It didn't look like a restaurant from the outside. It was part of a bigger building. But we found it, walked in, and we're seated right away. All the staff we encountered were friendly. And the restaurant was very, very clean. There were two clean, gender neutral bathrooms in the back.  We were given menus and my friend and I only ordered pho. They had other foods too, but my friend and I reallly wanted pho. I believe we got the house special pho (not sure if there's a specific name lol).  We waited maybe 20 mins for the pho. Where we come from, this was a pretty long wait for pho. But we assumed that since it took longer, everything was fresh.  The pho: sooo good! It's not the best pho I've had, but it was definitely one of the best ones. The portion was big. It wasn't too oily. There was a good amount of meat and noodles but not too overwhelming.  Definitely would come back next time I end up in Vegas and want some pho.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HNVU1WVboEeUj5m9dzP5uw.text: Giving 3 stars was kind've a generous gesture. Their menu is very simple only maybe 16 items on there at most. The place is more a modern american pho restaurant. The price is kind've steep. $12 for pho (yikes!). The food took quite awhile to come and they didn't give us utensils so we had to wait even longer.   The food was okay, I've had way better. The pho broth is very sweet. The filet mignon was tender and cooked to perfection, but they skimped on the meat portion. The plate was more pine apple and bell-peppers than meat. And the bbq plate I ordered didn't even come with a side of fish sauce I had to request for it.  Once the food was finished the bill came out and our tab had an extra order of 3 bowls of pho which totaled out to $140? The waitress took her sweet time to come and correct our receipt. And then there is a service charge! Are you serious? Gratuity for 4 people?  Not authentic and pretty pricey.

ehehEjC8jFlqUND-QwMptA.text: The food was amazing. Especially the green thai tea  That being said the service was the worst service I've ever had. Took waiting almost 30 minutes for me to realize they weren't going to just come to our table. The service continued to be abysmal.  I was required to snag servers as they past to get get every additional items they didn't bring or didn't refill.   I also had to correct the check at the end.  In addition Almost every item on the special menu was unavailable.  The only reason I'm giving 2 stars was the food was rather good. But the entire experience was one not worth repeating.

coIrZ9cCTZjkA28bU_oUpA.text: For one, I must admit I'm not much of a Pho person, but since it's starting to get a little chilly out and I wasn't feeling too hot, I decided to try this place out. It's located on the corner of Bonneville around law firms but the decor and lighting caught my eye.  I ordered the veggie pho and shrimp rolls. Unfortunately, my server forgot to ring in my shrimp rolls and I got them towards the end of my meal but made up for it by comping it, along with a great smile and sense of humor. Overall, I was content with the food and the service was great. Thanks, Deondre!

4pE6xQUS3OypHR9NvT5ODg.text: I was in Vegas for a golf trip in November, and had the first day to myself. I walked around downtown looking for a place to eat, and came across Le Pho. I had an excellent lunch.   For starters I opted for the Le Pho Roll, which was grilled pork rolled in a rice sheet, and sliced for easy consumption. I loved it. The pork had a nice flavor, and the vegetables and herbs were fresh.   Up next was the pho. I ordered the ribeye pho, and added meatball. The broth was superb, perhaps some of my favorite pho broth around. The ribeye was good. Only complaint is the meatball tasted a little too much like meat, and not enough of the weird funk. Still, it was great.   I BSed with the bartender for awhile, and noticed the fine array of Japanese whiskeys they have on the back shelf. I had him pour me a pull of the Hibiki 21 year. That made for a very expensive lunch, but I'm glad I got to try it.

dxVemNv6Qyt6vgh5qKnFvw.text: Awesome food!! Everything is so flavorful and nothing tastes the same as another item. The drinks (especially the Moscow Mules) are BOMB! The green iced tea is tasty too. The staff is wonderful - so kind and attentive to our needs. I'll be back again and again!

MBWU8bLE-_nBi1syTrnYcA.text: Vietnamese cuisine at its best. Spent a low key saturday night here a few blocks away from the crazies on Fremont street to take in some garlic chicken noodle. Damn tasty if you ask me. The food was quick to the table and the server was friendly and professional and helpful. There is a nice size full service bar in case anybody is parched. Hey! that reminds me of a joke i heard in Ireland  ( 2 Irishmen walk out of a bar ........................ It COULD happen !!!! )

NU05o0cwJ6Ds0rb1ACVrcw.text: This is a regular spot for me, since it's in the same building that I live in. Nice relaxed atmosphere and vibe. The dishes are always consistent, so I know now what to expect whenever/ whatever I order. The LePho Rolls, a signature item, are addictive.

Jmspq0_4nJtmdjtugd5D3Q.text: Place is bomb.   Pho dip, grilled oysters, chicken wings, green tea Thai iced tea. All great.   Great happy hour menu.

58h1n4ytE5ndVRa1taeL-Q.text: Just not workin' for me.   My wife and I have tried it multiple times, giving chances to have good experiences, and almost every time it ends in a disappointment. This time I had to add SALT to their classic beef broth it was so bland.  There are just SO many more places in Vegas that offer bigger portions, cheaper prices, and tastier broth.   Sorry Le Pho, and hope your business the best.

frWhqp-Uc-zVG_B9D1NwJg.text: Probably the best place downtown to eat at.  I come here at least once a week and usually ends up to be to 2 times a week.  I always get the Chicken or Ribeye Pho.  The chicken Pho is really good and worth every penny spent.  Now the Ribeye is even better than that.  I could litterly eat the ribeye every day.  I ordered the egg roll and spicy chicken wings as an appetizer and those were just as good.  I have never had bad meal here.  I highly recommend this place to every person I know.

qEmemF37QhvY_Jije9l5qQ.text: My wife and I were staying nearby on Freemont Street, and we were looking for a good Pho restaurant in the area. We found this restaurant through Yelp and I must say our experience was amazing! The restaurant has a hip vibe with a nice bar, craft beer and cocktails, as well as a full Vietnamese menu. We were promptly greeted as we sat ourselves by the bartender, she was very friendly and took/brought our drink orders quickly. We both ordered the beef pho and shrimp spring rolls..they were both delicious. The meat was definitely some of the best I've ever had in a Pho soup, and the flavor of the broth was outstanding! I want to try the sandwiches next time we're in Vegas, because they have excellent reviews as well. I highly recommend this to locals and visitors to the city.

e-k43BI5I_69EG08IQ4fjw.text: Worst experience ever was told my order would be ready within 20 minutes 40 minutes later she came back and said 5 more minutes then she said they're really busy it's going to be another 20 minutes Not to mention the C rating on the wall by the Clark County Health District

y2j7xJPCfyz_kB6fiC45TA.text: Very modern atmosphere, and really unique flavors. The portion was huge, much more than I would've expected. Attentive service (but not intrusive). I had a wonderful experience, and would definitely recommend it for locals and tourists alike!

Guu_apLJzRK4z58vH62Qsg.text: I've been there a few times to try their pho. First time it was ok. The pho tasted good. the waiter was nice as well. It's a bit pricey.   Second and third time was disappointing. Waiters were still nice, but the broth of the pho had way too much salt and MSG, not to mention they put even more salt on top of the beef.   Apparently the broth is pre-seasoned, and you can't order it with less salt. I'd suggest to go to Chinatown area to get some nicer and cheaper pho there.   Food is 2 star, I added 1 more star for the friendly staff.

3cINl4pKuVGg7fwuBmbyKw.text: This place is a AMAZING! The Chicken Wings (Saigon Buffalo)...bomb.com! The homemade sauce is absolutely delicious! The Vegetable Pho (Beef Broth) was fresh, light and flavorful. The entire staff engaged in friendly, prompt and attentive service. Thank you, Robert, Jasmine, Nikki and Jordan for your hospitality and hats off to the chef for cooking authentic Vietnamese cuisine! This place is highly recommended. Everything about this place is delightful. My expectations were not met - they were exceeded and I will be back very soon!

f9np62z4Ht1wJSsyzhX4eA.text: Big portion of pho, fusion type foods. The portion is sufficient, flavor wise, it's definitely more in the bland side for me. However, this restaurant most likely doesn't use MSG, so just add more soy sauce to your bowl :) Excellent Service!

HLKVaHd3LPPE-sJdW4drVw.text: Been going here for awhile now. Always a good meal. Never seen it busy. There were 4 customers + myself when I went there this evening. I placed my order to go over the phone. When I walked in, there were 2 employees behind the bar talking. I waited a few minutes before becoming inpatient. So, as my order was staring at me at the hostess stand, I removed the receipt from the take out bag & walked up to the bar with cash in hand asking if I could pay for my meal. A girl came from behind the bar & took the receipt. She then walked to the hostess stand, grabbed my order & said she would be back. She took my order to the kitchen. I work very hard for my $ so I walked out & went to another Thai restaurant that actually acted like they wanted my business. What a shame as it's so close to my house.

aPEWLNVVr7evgU1apVt6mg.text: So terrific! Great atmosphere out of the craziness of the Vegas crowd. Great service too. We had a lemon mule specialty drink. So good. Chicken and veggie pho was the best I'd ever had. We will be back.

Ogs7NDFu1ujgnYvZuKkK6g.text: Decided to check this place out because it was within walking distance of our hotel. Nice restaurant with a nice bar, but the service was super slow and the pho was way too salty. Neither one of us could even finish our bowl of pho because of how salty it was.

s4qL5MQXpv5KjTMKkkdFIg.text: This place is so GOOD. I got the Ox tail pho w fried tofu pieces. SO much flavor. I literally can't eat any other pho after eating here. Definitely go here!!!

hYph_drpNjigwwh5qOOqgQ.text: So, I am picky when it comes to pho, esp. considering I'm from MN, we have affordable and great pho restaurants! This place is not bad, but I don't think I would consider it authentic Vietnamese pho. I've been there twice and to me, it's a hit or miss. This time around, the pho was pretty salty, and the pho roll was practically falling apart. Not sure if that's how it's supposed to be wrapped?

usQ-XWeC_UkZyxIM0I3Z6w.text: All the servers here are very sweet and attentive! Le Pho is a modern Vietnamese restaurant, but the food was still just as authentic. Obviously, it doesn't compare to a home-cooked meal, but it came close.   Love that Asian food is getting the exposure it deserves and Le Pho is doing a great job at making the menu friendly to those who are unfamiliar with Vietnamese food.  CHECK IN AND GET THE COFFEE, because their coffee was legit and absolutely delicious!  Two vermicelli noodle bowls (bun thit nuong) with egg rolls = $28, plus tip = $33. Kinda on the pricey side, but worth the experience.

7_wCc8MNt-aP1Ptuw3Ahng.text: I just had their happy hour Pho and Wings , and I think I just became a die hard regular.  Great quality And great price

Nu5jPo3R24CWmVe5ojP5DA.text: I was incredibly excited hear Le Pho was opening in the food desert that is the legal district. I had many dreams of quick, delicious Vietnamese lunches in my future.   The reality, however, resulted in much "meh."  I ordered the house Banh Mi that included taro chips. The portion was fine, not big. However, the big downer was the visibly burned baguette. Whatever great flavors lurking in the sandwich were destroyed by the overcooked bread. It could be flavor city in there but I'll never know. The taro chips also seemed overcooked -- but that could have been the residual burned bread taste overpowering everything.  Obviously, not every baguette is burned (I hope). But, quality control should be better for a $9.73 sandwich (includes tax).  I'll give it another shot.

t6LL0rd0C5AY867s7edZrA.text: The ambience here is amazing, service is great, and the food is awesome. It's as authentic as you could get, and the fresh traditional spring roll comes with the right peanut sauce and is crunchy and fresh. The pho is legit as well. We walked over from the Fremont Experience and it was worth every step

5YquLR_JLjx3vdZI8P0rIQ.text: I literally uttered awww!!! I was sooo sad that I had just taken my last bite of their juicy banh mi.  Definitely could have this everyday.  This place would be better if the servers have a better vibe.  Is hospitality dead in Las Vegas?

sX0cA6-DvQWSsf2t1gaq5Q.text: I am very impressed with this pho restaurant. While the price is a tad higher than other pho restaurants, they put a lot more meat into the soup, which makes the price worthwhile. Both of my kids loved their soup. Their broth is very flavorful, but not over-spiced. The service was excellent. At the end of the meal they brought us complementary flan. We were very satisfied and plan to come back regularly

qHguBsK29ho_If1CJfCHrQ.text: This place is Le Bomb!  Oxtail pho and the traditional spring rolls are Le Delicious!  If I work or live downtown, this would definitely be my Le Place to go!  ;-)

UZpW5CXOlF-WWlYEucYaIQ.text: Food is decent. Have been twice now. 1st time place was empty pretty much. Ordered a sandwich and a beer. Sandwich was tasty and on point cost of beer was pricey. 2nd time going took 2 other people and given it was packed but finally got a table after about 20 minutes. We all 3 ordered the Pho even more so because we were hungry and wanted to order the easiest thing on menu it took over 30 minutes before we got our 1st soup only 1 came out had to wait another 15 minutes before the other 2 soups came out, would have liked everyone to get their food at same time then when we did get it it was wrong. Could have been a simple fix because by the time our waitress finally came back we had picked out all the stuff that didn't belong in it and she could have just gotten us extra steak meat instead of just taking our soups away and it taking another 15 mins to yet receive a new one, which I suggested. We did get 2 fresh bowls and it was tasty decent broth still not as good as kim pho long my favorite place to get pho but it was good. Lack of service since, our waitress was so hard to flag down and not very good at her job and it taking a total of almost 3 hour just to eat so pho is way too long. I might give this place another try and see how it goes.

9kamtfphIteKIv8VmeHD8A.text: AMAZING!!! My husband and I have been looking for a good Vietnamese place since we moved here and we finally found it. Everything taste like authentic Vietnamese flavors. My grandma would definitely approve...kudos to the chef!!!   The best Vietnamese food in Vegas is not on Spring Mountain.  It is downtown.  Food is priced very well.  Flavors are light and not heavy.  Who'd a thunk that?#buzzybytes

C7S_AdrohXmUp4mLUhZ0Yg.text: A young and modern style Vietnamese restaurant. However I was looking for a bowl of authentic pho in a hurry. I am ok with the pho but not really impressed. However, it could be my fault as I could not find a old school papa mama shop but this one during the dark night. 0cQaXH6z6oXTyB37Ecb83Q.text: Fantastic as usual, thanks Jasmin! Highly recommend the Pho Dipped, I think I need one more to go....

QZQmUvNaSFkHQ7-gpIZmfQ.text: This place has a really cool vibe and the staff is really nice. I do think their menu is quite pricy for the pho it was 9$ for chicken pho. But it was totally worth it! It was really good, and our waitress Jasmine was super nice and provided outstanding service! I'll definitely come back again the next time I come to Vegas!

5M7X4sXGiKb4ucrskjQ08w.text: I've never had Vietnamese before, let me tell you, it's full of flavor. And Le Pho delivers! With a great location and atmosphere, perfect for lunch or dinner. nothing has disappointed me on the menu!

l6yHRcR5lqHKZsta6rbBlw.text: Went the other day with my co-workers as we like to try all the new places downtown. I ended up getting the House Banh Mih which was very tasty. It was my second choice as I really wanted the duck bowl but was told they were out when I tried to order.   I will definitely come back again to try the duck bowl as it really did sound delicious.   Overall service was good as my water was constantly filled and the chef? Came over to check on us.   Hopefully all menu items are available next time.

LIUNF_ACCtRp53eJUdn_lQ.text: Had lunch at this lil spot. It is a smaller place but nice. Diamond was our server she was very attentive and helpful with recommendations. The wait time from when we ordered to when we recieved our food was short. The place is very clean. The only negative things about the place is the music was a little loud. Other than that a great Lil place for some good food and cocktails. Definitely a place we will go back to.

w7oZEr9GhlM-Ms4pMJdIrQ.text: My new favorite family bar restaurant downtown. Great service, happy hour menu & atmosphere. Wings are sooooo crispy . Tried raw oysters for the 1st time and i must admit i loved them!!!  Please try the fried egg rolls, oxtail fried rice & deep fried rice. See you guys next friday with friends!!!

MOUD53s8Lm4dz1bUsJ5LZw.text: Absolutely the worst service I have ever received. We made reservations for 15-18 they didn't make record of it, then when we arrived there a was broken. They sat us did not bring us water menus or anything. It was an absolute joke.

iCos16jGyd-GfqHJllpYxw.text: In Vegas for work and had had to grab quick bite. Vegan gluten free Pho was pretty dang tasty. Will definitely stop in again the next time I'm in town.

DkIgNnAX1ZDOEz412XslYQ.text: This Vietnamese food was fresh-tasting, well prepared, and served in a trendy eastern inspired environment. If you're willing to spend an extra few dollars per item, this will be worth it. I had the vegetable Pho with tendon, nice variety. But the French dip bahn mi sounds pretty amazing...

FDvgNwPuV-JrfOS06MnHnQ.text: Unless you know it's here you could miss such an amazing little spot downtown. The place is clean and has the industrial decor- feel. Everyone was friendly and the food was delicious. I have never had pho before so I had egg rolls (which were so good I ordered some to go) and Vermicelli Noodle Bowl and it was very good AND filling! Our waitress Melissa was helpful in explaining the beer selection and all my questions I had about the menu, she recommended the friend rice and it was also a good choice. All in all I would definitely come again.

O7y21PEcVG8Eq1CXU4drlA.text: This place looks cool and it's conveniently located downtown. Unfortunately the vegan broth is literally water. No flavor at all. It makes it so you cannot have the vegan pho because the noodles are totally bland as well. This place would do well to improve the flavor of their food. Especially considering the prices are quite high.

P0mKeQjCD3yvVGFYmfo3BQ.text: My husband and I have eaten at many, many pho places and decided to stop here during our trip in Vegas bc of the 4 stars. Restaurant was clean, ambiance was inviting, hostess greeted and seated us right away. I ordered the house special pho for $12. It came with ribeye, flank, tripe, tendon and meatballs, so the works. Husband wanted the same thing, but without tripe and tendon. When our food came out, everything looked amazing. As we started eating, we kept finding HUGE pieces of ribeye slices in our bowls and if you've eaten at any pho restaurant before, you know that the meat slices are thin and able to be eaten without having to cut it apart first. Bc we had to cut it up first, we didn't really care to even eat the meat. I also found a few pieces of ribeye bone fragments in mine which def wasn't a good thing. Afterwards when our bill came out, I was charged $12 for mine, however hubs was charged $16 for his which didn't make sense bc his bowl of pho was exactly similar to mine but without tripe and tendon. What the waitress did was charge him for a ribeye pho ($10) and then did an add on of tendon (extra $3) and another add on on meatballs (another extra $3). Not sure how she thought that made sense, but overall, wouldn't return since the pho was not up to par.

MfCjZs37SCiCPDMpQe0Wgg.text: I had such high hopes when reading the reviews on this place but was severely let down. We ordered the Le Pho Roll and the Duck Noodle Bowl. Everything was over salted and didn't have much flavor. We won't be back.

aKy7mkR-JhOBcOq05XIDhw.text: Food was different this time around, service was ok. The main thing I wanted to comment about is the hypocrisy of telling a guest that we do not use straws, a big push from California's thoughts on being green,. The fact is it's a fad,and farce, the real problem is not straws its diapers,  really I've seen the pictures in recycling of our trash in the processing center for a MAJOR city. Again the politics in this food establishment is to say the least stupid.Who wants to touch their lips to a glass foggy and blemished from the lack of a clean glass.I would rather take my chances licking my floor. I asked my server for a straw, he said rather pugnet, that they no longer have straws and pointed to the sign, really ??? Looking around to the service bar there were at least 4 cups,  all with PLASTIC  straws...plus your bar gives out PLASTIC stir straws in there drinks! Give up your politics, and stick with customer service, and when you do something like this, go with a paper or aluminium straw! No longer my favorite pho spot just another fake green initiative from someone who thinks that it is something cool...not cool!

Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow PLASTIC STRAWS on the bar for the wait staff a violation from the health department because they are preparing food.

wj-Lpn9d8OKjcYg69zEH-A.text: First off the customer service is pretty good, music is pretty jamming. Its not bothersome unless ur a classical gal. Other than that the food is pretty great. My top tier recommend favorite meal of the place is their Le Pho Rolls. And their Chicken Pho is pretty great as well.

ko866FgMAhu798r7bkUuFw.text: Amazing pho, great costumer service, and cool atmosphere. Definitely try the pho rolls!

baK0TeuwKMOe2a_BHTOMZg.text: Standard pho done well. Service good food tasty. Had the pho and was very happy. Would go again in a minute. Highly recommended.

Jghs87lPpae3uhE4G-LLBw.text: Place was amazing!!!!  My hubby had the pho and I had the garlic noodles!!!  Definitely coming back everytime we visit Vegas!!!  Our waitress was amazing and very sweet. Close enough for us to walk to from our hotel!

t1Xo9aI6dzOE7LXZEwL3jA.text: Inside environment is good. We ordered oxtail pho and grill combination, flavor is good but too salty.

X0tIysqVTAgA_OHFojlQzw.text: This pho was excellent loved the fact that it's within walking distance of the golden nugget and greyhound station. There are signs stating no one under 21 allowed. The sake I ordered was served in a can, not the typical jug it's served in so it got cold quickly. I would visit this place again

p6RzjySNnp0JmTg3zMVasg.text: Located on the ground floor of The Juhl directly on the corner of Bonneville Avenue and 3rd Street. Ample street parking surrounding the building and beyond. Very easy to access and away from the the usual tourist traffic of DTLV.  After three visits, I've had a really good sampling of the menu. There are still a couple dishes I want to try, so I would definitely try those on my next visit. Bottom line: great food and great service. Although the location is very far from me, I'm happy to make the drive!  Chicken Wings ($7): Crispy Wings quick-tossed with housemade tamarind sauce; topped with garlic chips. The chicken is cooked well and the sauce is delicious. There is a Five-Spice Salt and Pepper version ($5) offered during Social Hour (4-7PM daily) that is also really good.  Egg Rolls ($8): Fried Northern-style with pork, crab meat, Wood Ear mushrooms, carrot, and cellophane noodles. Crunchy and tasty; a solid egg roll.  Traditional Spring Roll ($7): Shrimp, pork, vermicelli noodles, fried wonton, bean sprouts, mint, and lettuce. Decent, but nothing exciting.  Vegan Spring Roll ($7): Fried tofu, shiitake mushroom, bell pepper, grilled onion, lettuce, mint, and bean sprouts. I love this option for my non-meat eating friends, but there wasn't a lot of flavor going on.  Le Pho Roll ($7): Grilled five spice pork, basil, lettuce, and scallion oil. So, so much flavor in the pork and accompanying ingredients. The rice noodle is perfect, too. This is my favorite roll!  Nem Nuong Roll ($7): Vietnamese pork roll, fried wonton, lettuce, bean sprout, and mint. Just like the Traditional Spring Roll, this is just okay and not very exciting.  Bo Bia Roll ($8): Lap Cheong, dried shrimp, shredded omelet, and jicama. This is a fun "breakfast" roll that is also very tasty.  Lotus Root Salad ($10): Lotus root, pork, shrimp, roasted peanuts, cilantro, and fish sauce vinaigrette. Served with sesame rice crackers. I love the crunch from the lotus root and everything tastes so great together. Great low-carb option without sacrificing taste.  Vietnamese Poached Chicken Salad ($9): Poached chicken, cabbage, red onion, rau ram (Vietnamese coriander), crushed roasted peanuts, fried shallots, crushed shrimp rice crackers, and fish sauce vinaigrette. This was good, but no exciting flavors either.  House Special Banh Mi ($9): Toasted French baguette with pork cold cuts, pork pate, mayonnaise, pickled daikon and carrots, jalapeno, scallion, and cilantro. The bread was crusty, but soft, so it was the perfect vehicle for this popular sandwich. Tasty, though it could use more meat!  Pho Dipped Banh Mi ($11): Toasted French baguette with slow-cooked beef brisket, bean sprout, basil, pickled daikon and carrots, jalapeno, hoisin, and sriracha sauce. Served with a bowl of pho broth. Even though I'm usually drawn to a traditional Ban Mi (I loove the meats), this is a really great sandwich and their pho broth is seriously amazing.  Ribeye Pho ($10): I had this on my first visit and it revived my faith in Pho. Again, the broth is phenomenal and the vermicelli noodles are just amazing. I've had the House Special Pho ($12) as well with Ribeye, flank, tendon, tripe and meatball. Also wonderful.  Vermicelli Bowl ($17): Grilled pork, lettuce, bean sprouts, mint, crushed roasted peanuts, scallion oil, fish sauce, and vermicelli noodles. *Add Shrimp and Egg Rolls. They have the best vermicelli noodles in town; it's slightly thicker and have a great texture. The dish itself is fantastic. The charbroiled pork and shrimp are really delicious.  Ben Thanh Market Fried Rice ($12): Dried shrimp, Lap Cheong, eggs, and diced asparagus. Topped with salted egg yolk. Everything about this dish would make me think I'd like it, but it was rather bland compared to a lot of the other flavors going on in this place.  Hoi An Chicken Rice ($10): Poached chicken, pickled daikon and carrot, and turmeric rice. This is very similar to Hainan poached chicken. The chicken is flavorful and prepared nicely. The rice is also tasty and everything is great together. Add Nuoc Cham for added deliciousness.  Duck Noodle Bowl ($15): Five-spiced braised duck, thin egg noodles, bok choy, shiitake mushroom, organic Onsen egg, scallion, and garlic chips. The dish was a little salty, so that made it hard to fully enjoy, but the noodles and ingredients were great.  Wok-Tossed Filet Mignon ($18): Wok-tossed filet mignon and seasonal vegetables with black pepper sauce, watercress, red torpedo, and spring onion mix. Served with white rice. A good version of "Shaking Beef;" flavorful and tender steak.  Banh Beo ($9): Steamed rice cakes with ground mung bean, dried shrimp, scallion, and crispy pork rinds. Not bad, but it was missing crispy shallot and lacking slightly in flavor.  Favorites: Le Pho Roll, Bo Bia Roll, Pho Dipped Banh Mi, Ribeye Pho, House Special Pho, Vermicelli Bowl, and Hoi An Chicken Rice.

nMrOBDS4-llsARyFcGvK3g.text: "Even in Town they make food for your people?" begins Midwest poker bud as we look over the menu.  "That's it, guys, it's time to play Fear Factor, Asian style with the gentleman of fairest complexion" I announce to snickers, then...  "Haha, no weird Asian stuff!" joyfully proclaims farm boy America.  The brainchild of  Chef Khai Vu of District One, Le Pho serves Americanized Vietnamese that happen to work well while grabbing a drink on a DTLV pub crawl.    Americanized equals familiar flavors and ingredients.  No culantro, lighter extraction in the pho broth, unusually light hand in use of fermented fish sauces, sour flavors missing.  Bottom line, traditionalist, don't ditch your favorite Chinatown Vietnamese eatery just yet.  First and foremost, this is a bar that serves Vietnamese food not the other way around.  Food pairs with drinks.  For shareable dishes, "Grandma's Grilled Pork", soy marinated pork cheeks; juicy,  somewhat chewy.  A tasty bar bite.  Good assortment of rolls, the egg roll, crispy and stuffed full with pork, crab, shrimp, rice noodles, and toothsome wood ear mushrooms.  Rolled in lettuce, dip in the sauce.  Good as any.  Interesting "Le Pho Roll, unmistakable flavor of five spice pork and lettuce rolled in a wide sheet of uncut pho noodle and dressed with a scallion oil.  Interesting but one dimensional.   A lotus root salad with pork, shrimp, cilantro, peanuts dressed in a fish sauce vinaigrette and served in crispy, airy rice cracker has an unexpectedly mild flavor.  Eat it fast or the cracker gets soggy and sticks to your teeth.  The pho doesn't measure up to that of its sister restaurant.  Perhaps an off day.  Light and almost watery.  The house special contains a good portion of raw ribeye, flank, clean and tender tendon, soft tripe and meatballs.  Opt to add some bone marrow for added richness for $1 more.  Begs for hoisin and chili oil to be dumped directly in the bowl but satisfying none the less.  Note:  Typical Southeast Asian service.  Dishes are brought out whenever they are ready.  This is customary.  If you don't like it, order in waves but be prepared for some annoyance on the part of the servers.  Decent selection of beer.  Reasonably priced.    Pub crawl worthy, yes. Meal worthy?  That depends on you.

XVCyxDFeT4ZsbCf6uwTmWg.text: As a Vietnamese-American that has gone to 100+ Vietnamese restaurants around the US and Global, the food that I had tonight was okay. Environment is cool, overpriced, and food is okay, but if you are wanting authentic Vietnamese food with lots of flavor, not your place.   Egg rolls: 3 pieces cut in 1/2 to equal 6. They were bit a greasy and soggy.   Nem Nuong: 3 pieces on a bed of white vermicelli noodles and lettuce and they were pretty good.   Duck Bowl: option dry or in broth and we got it in broth and it was extremely bland. They served the dish and forgot noodles!   Pork vermicelli bowl: decent. Didn't like that they added fish sauce when served.   Pho: overpriced and broth decent.

fUSE7AL7SmmiNTKOj8NvIA.text: Gave this place a go for a family birthday dinner since we love Le Thai but wanted to avoid Fremont with my nieces. I'm disappointed to say that we waited sooo long to finally come here. The food is absolutely delicious, even according to my picky father-in-law who has spent years traveling in Asia. Ei0Qa-B7fyEaWoPB_YesXw.text: I've been here three times since this placed opened. And, the score is three stars because two of the times I've come, the service has been horrible.   The first time I came was during the first week or so of opening. The place was swamped as to  be expected. My friend and I sat at the bar. Our orders were messed up, and I ended up taking most of my order to go due to using most of my lunch time waiting to get the food fixed.  The second time, I was blown away with the service. I was with about five other people, and the service was amazing. Everything was correct- food came promptly.   And, then I went this past Friday, and the service failed, again. It took forever to get my friend's and my food ordered. I never really saw our waitress despite ordering and paying the bill.  However, despite the bad service, the food is great! My favorite is the Pho Dipped. I've ordered two of the three times.   Perhaps, the alternative to the bad service would be asking for my food to go?

BjomKzagHRkZymGoOnEshA.text: I love that this place is literally a block and walking distance from my job.  It's definitely something different from the usual burgers, pizza and salad.  Finally, more diversity.  I read that this place is owned by some of the other Vietnamese Pho places like So Pho 1 that I usually go to.    The inside of this place is very nice.  Looks very... classy and upscale, but it is a casual setting.  I like how there's a hostess that seats you like you see in a fancy restaurant.    Food.  I ordered a Ribeye Pho and the Nem Nuong Roll, all to go.  The egg rolls at Vietnamese restaurants are one of my favorites.  Although the size of them where a tad bit on the smaller side from what I am use to at other Vietnamese restaurants.  These were way smaller.  I enjoyed the flavor, just not the size, especially for the price.  I guess that is what is expected coming from a downtown joint.  The Ribeye Pho was good too.  The flavor of the broth was good, but the ribeye itself, there was something off about it.  I don't know if it was just me, but the meat to me was chewy.  But it all tasted good.    Will I come back, definitely.  So with that being said, happy eatings! @~~}~~~~
