C_mEwimMfyKcUVPDM-pGYg.text: I'm a low-carb eater, so you might think a Vietnamese noodle house would not be high on my lists of go-to restaurants. But Le Pho has some of the best salads I have ever eaten. So even if I don't partake of their tasty-looking noodle dishes, this is one restaurant that I hope to put into heavy rotation.  I have been to Le Pho twice now, and both times service was quick and friendly. On my last visit, I had the poached chicken salad ($9), which I probably would have considered the best on the menu if I hadn't had the watercress beef salad ($12) the previous week. Both salads were perfectly dressed (nothing ruins a good salad more than a heavy hand on the dressing), with a nice balance of meat and vegetables. The chicken salad was tossed with a light, sweet fish sauce; and the beef salad had a heartier ginger-soy blend. Beautiful presentations both times, and the portion sizes were just right.  Another great thing about Le Pho is that they offer iced green tea. None of that nasty passion-fruit concoction here! I usually order a glass of wine with a salad, but the tea here is so good that it literally made me into a teetotaler--at least at Le Pho! ($3, but well worth it.)  I may be the only person who orders salads here, but as long as these two winners are on the menu, I'll keep on ordering them. Delish!

K1G0jnmfgHmjREcMSj2uDA.text: This place is PHOnomenal! Le Pho is my favorite place to eat in DTLV; I'd even venture to say it's one of my favorite places to eat in the whole city. In fact, when it came to soup, I was an I-prefer-ramen-over-pho type of person until visiting Le Pho. Now I'm obsessed with pho, though I'm finding other establishments don't really compare to Le Pho. Of course, with any restaurant, much of this can be attributed to personal preference but let me break it down for you:  Ribeye Pho ($10): The broth is perfect- it's so flavorful. This is a favorite of mine and I've had it many times. There's plenty of nice pieces of meat- meaning, you don't get just the fatty pieces. Personally, I enjoy clean pieces of meat so this is a winner for me. You can split this dish, and all pho dishes, into two bowls for an additional $3. They charge you extra because you get a little more pho than when it's just in one big bowl.  Chicken Pho ($9): Before trying the Chicken Pho, the Ribeye Pho was the apple, er.. pho, of my eye. Now, I constantly crave the Chicken Pho. The broth is also incredibly flavorful and delicious. Plenty of meat-- a lot of white meat, which I enjoy. The noodles are perfect as well.  Oxtail Fried Rice ($14): Amazing flavor. This has become a regular order for me and my boyfriend. Pro tip: get it with a fried egg on top for $1.50 more.  Traditional Spring Rolls ($7): Had these once with the gluten free option. The wontons were removed and I was offered fish sauce on the side instead of peanut sauce. Nice, fresh flavor. Great beginning to your meal.  Chicken Wings ($8): The tamarind sauce is very tasty. I love the flavor combo going on here. You get six wings per order and my only complaint is that they are on the small side.  Taro Ice Cream ($5): This was a dessert option the last time we dined. We thoroughly enjoyed the combination of taro, shredded coconut, and crushed peanuts. It's perfect for when your belly is full of pho but you still want something sweet to top off your meal.  I've enjoyed everything I've tried with the exception of the Bone Marrow Fried Rice. To me, it tasted heavily of fish sauce, but I don't even know if that is a key ingredient. I'm not a big fan of bone marrow in the first place so don't let my opinion on this dish sway you away from trying it. I'd like to sample more of the menu but I come here for the pho!  My only gripe is they can be inconsistent. One time I ordered Chicken Pho and it tasted like a different broth than usual. We also brought some friends here and the Ribeye Pho was so incredibly salty. We were slightly embarrassed after raving on and on about the broth; we insisted to our friends that it's not usually that salty. One thing that is consistent though is the service. The waitstaff and bartender are always fast and friendly. Veronica is our favorite!  Oh, and if you have allergies then you'll be in heaven here. They are allergy friendly and many things on the menu are gluten free or optional, including all the pho. Just talk to your waiter about your restriction(s) and he or she will check with the kitchen for you.  Give this place a try! I'm so addicted that I make the drive from Summerlin to DTLV once a week just to eat here. I recommend Le Pho to all my friends and family!  TL;DR  Get the pho.

mTpIqdPT_xVXW6PUGcAmvA.text: I heard about Le Pho from a coworker and didn't realize there was a pho restaurant downtown. Well I'm happy to say there is and it's really good! I got the house pho and Vietnamese coffee which was delicious. If you are around this area and want your fix of good pho with yummy broth I'd highly suggest stopping by and eating!

juP4LfJ5IyVXKKf7ONlacg.text: In a city where there are plenty of late night Vietnamese restaurants to choose from, it might feel hard to stand out. But Le Pho is a truly a memorable place in my mind for a number of reasons. First of all, the decor is gorgeous! The deep green wallpaper and wooden tables are so romantic. Also, the big windows give guests a beautiful view of the City Hall's light show at night and plenty of people watching in the afternoon.   Now when it comes to food, the flavors of Le Pho are unmatched. One of my favorite Vietnamese dishes is vermicelli with pork and egg rolls. This is by far one of the best egg rolls I have ever tasted. It doesn't taste homemade, but the flavors are so rich - there is no need to dunk it in sauce.   My only gripe is that it's a little pricey for what I'd typically be willing to pay for Vietnamese food, but the portion sizes are generous so I'll let it slide. Overall, I am a fan!

J6flr4fSzmmmVCCYwulXMg.text: I'm so glad we found this spot close to our room at the 4 Queens! It was a 10 minute walk and the pho was on point. The egg rolls were a good different, but a tad on the pricey side. Service was wonderful and we never had an empty glass.  After loading down with pho it was well worth the $3 fare for an uber back to Fremont street!

82BU7EOrPyHOt7dC6yQt2Q.text: Food here is awesome!! Me and misses walked from Fremont street to try it. We were greeted promptly and told we could sit anywhere we like. We ordered the egg rolls and spring rolls, and both were great. The egg rolls were light and flavorful. Definitely a treat, unlike most cookie cutter egg rolls. The star of the show was definitely the pho. I ordered the house special and added a poached egg, it was awesome. The misses order the ribeye pho which was also awesome, she also ordered the bone marrow oil which added a richness and dept of flavor to the pho. Thanks for the great service Jasmine, and thank you for answering all of our questions about the menu!! When in vegas, this will definitely be a must go to for lunch or dinner!

7xhCnbU0TjD0kUGG0QBkAA.text: Great place! Food was delicious. Visiting from L.A. and  was hungry for some good Vietnamese food. I was not disappointed. I will be visiting everytime im in Vegas.

THiHSfPaDPNqdsAxhdH5WQ.text: This is a great place for pho. The broth is amazing. Had the Ox tail pho which was amazing. The place is clean and very modern style with nice vibe. The staff was efficient and friendly. The price  reasonable.

hL2DurBGE56VrHDVULIodQ.text: First off lets just say this....Food, great. Atmosphere, great. Service, great. So why the 3-stars? I'll just tell you a little story. I had a brand new debit card. NEVER used before or after eating lunch here, yesterday. However, I awoke this morning to find that $400 had been stolen from my account through a keyed-in card entry through a Square merchant account to a company named Fast Go, out of Brooklyn, NY. The first for $370, the second $30, and an additional failed attempt for $100.   Now, to Le Pho's defense their card processing machine is out front where the customers can see it. However, the thick asian waitress (three waitresses walking around at the time, can't recall her name) that served us, swiped the card to process the payment, then looked up at me (as if to see if I was watching) and smiled, then disappeared around the corner for a couple minutes before coming back with my card to have me sign. Coincidence? Maybe. But I can guarantee if I ever go back, I'll pay with cash. Cancelled the card. Reversed the payments. Will get my money back in a few day.

oVXACnrgcFg9Ve6Lvyfk-g.text: Wow and yay! Can't believe it's finally here! A Vietnamese Resturant with a Bar that is awesome!

la-uI-uxfCX0II3EY1HyTQ.text: We came here on a date night before a show at the smith's center. I have the beef Pho. My wife had one of the French dip sandwiches.  Both were amazing. We are back tonight for round #2. This time with another couple. I'll have something different. I'm excited to see how the Absinthe turns how. They have a chilled water drip to make the drink. This place has been added to our list of downtown date night spots.

OBZ61Ri55DVgtTslDAxrtQ.text: Ok this spot was good as far as pho goes. I got the wings off the happy hour menu they were ok. Also got some pork spring rolls forgot the name of the dish I really enjoyed those. Girlfriend got the chicken pho she said it was nothing worth mentioning. I got the rib eye pho I enjoyed it aside from the text of the beef, it was pretty chewy and bland. The green Thai iced tea was awesome. Would come back again, but nothing to write home about.

3Ff0dB6Wrf4I2OiGEoK90A.text: This is the first pho place I've ever been to that looks modern! The ambience was great. The restaurant was pretty big, and even had a sleek bar area with new tv's playing some sport game. The waitress' were super friendly and stopped my every once in awhile to check on us. Though the restaurant was modernized, the menu was authentic Vietnamese food. I ordered a pho with beef balls, and my boyfriend got a pho with all the different meats. This is the first and only place I've been to that had green thai tea on the menu. As an avid thai tea lover, I had to try it. It tasted almost the same as regular orange thai tea, but with a bit of a matcha taste to it instead. It was delicious. Our food arrived quickly. The broth was really hot, but didn't burn our tongues! The meat was great, and the broth was delicious. Not bland or overly salty. I was content. I was only able to finish half of my pho, but my boyfriend finished his and the rest of mine.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Pho Vietnamese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho w/ beef balls &amp; green thai tea

sT5C2WwQlGwGzPWKPOyrRQ.text: Enjoyed it immensely.   My mom's side of the family is from South Vietnam and their pho is the real deal because everyone knows the magic is in the soup.  Very rich and flavorful broth and will go back soon!

RWPLqM3QkPxURIIOAUMSAA.text: Le Yummm! I ordered the chicken pho and traditional spring rolls and both were excellent. My kids ordered the chicken wings and a vermicelli pasta dish and liked them both. Le Pho has a great ambiance. Our server was attentive, friendly, and speedy. Prices were reasonable. Highly recommend.

WDq9vu1sY3sUlXl4lptOXg.text: Love the atmosphere of this place. The menus and small details add a nice touch to the vibe of the place . The Vietnamese drip iced coffee was delicious . The staff is amazing !! Our waitress Jasmin was so helpful and the chef went above and beyond . I  this place

4roBQfkaUMpDTCDskSVxjA.text: This place has great food and everyone working is always really sweet! jk not really

KqmSrXCWIFVS5oYdBgQ3Zg.text: I just rolled into Vegas from a circuitous trip from Atlanta to Denver to SLC to a couple hot springs and campgrounds, all by car, got a few days in Vegas before my languid trip back up to Portland. (I'm spoiling myself. You should too.) As I tend to do, the first thing I do when I get back to civilization is get some pho. Being that Portland considers itself the pho capitol of everything, I was a little cautious at best, bring my first time in Vegas. I was pleasantly proven wrong! The drinks are top notch and the pho is fresh, delicious, and very quick. I am impressed. Will, my bartender/server guy, was friendly fast and efficient. And it was only after I ate that I found out tonight was their soft opening. I'm doubly impressed. You'd have thought they'd have had years of practice. So if you like pho and stiff drinks to go with it, this is your jam. I'm not telling any off my Portland friends, but this beats most their favorite places.

Qvfl1J8aIwb2SvU8G9qjpQ.text: My buddy and I were here today and we really liked the foods. We had the Le Pho Roll and House special pho. Every thing tastes great although the chef forgot to put the meet ball in our house special pho (?). A little bit slow service, but that's okay since it's new. Definitely come back next time.

V8E_WKGBrWprcVP_VmakMA.text: I had a nice experience here. Our server was named Jasmine and she was great! We had 2 house pho bowls and an order of traditional spring rolls. The house pho came with meatball, tendon, ribeye, and tripe. I LOVED IT. Then again, pho is one of my favorite dishes. The broth was delicious and the peanut sauce they served with the spring rolls was yummy too. I think I tasted a bit of coconut in the sauce, which I enjoyed. Service was prompt too, which was a plus for me since I went during my lunch break.
